Unfortunately they close the terrace quite early which is difficult to understand since surely no neighbors around who would complain on the 39-40th floor.  Would have loved to stay longer and enjoy more drinks during an amazing summer evening and under a sparkling firmament.

title: Very, very good.
comment: The food is sublime none of us could fault what we had and my steak was cooked to perfection. The service was excellent, we were a group of 5 and they ensured when requested that we had a window side table to enjoy the views. Very attentive when a food allergy risk was raised. Would recommend to anyone, menu may seem pricey but the food served is worth every penny

title: just above expectations
comment: Me and my girlfriend Ana, celebrated my 25th of birthday in the Bokan restaurant, where my girlfriend proposed me to get married. Absolutely was fantastic, the best and one of the most important night in our life. I would like to say a big big thank you for the team and the fantastic kitchen, and you guys Guillaume, Jerome, Constantin, Georgiana, Pedro, Nelson,Chef Guillaume, Emanuele,Adam you are guys just amazing! Thank you for everything, you guys made our night fantastic and guys you are doing amazing job.  This is the place where we feel absolutely good with so many many good memories. Can not wait to go again. :)  Barbie

title: Outstanding from start to finish! Thank you!
comment: I have been meaning to write this review since our visit to Bokan. We actually visited on 19th May, which is our wedding anniversary as well as being the date of the Royal wedding. The place was absolutely buzzing with wonderful happy vibes due to the special occasion that many were there to watch on the large screens. We watched a bit and I have to say it was nothing short of spectacular to be able to watch the royal wedding with the London skyline as the back drop. They really had set things out nicely for those wanting to come along and partake in this celebration. We were made to feel extra special as it was our anniversary and every member of staff we encountered gave us their best wishes. We were seated and the views were, in my opinion, the best I have ever experienced in London. We were served by Guillaume and also the husband and wife team. They were effortlessly friendly and professional. Nothing was too much trouble. Honestly top notch staff! The food was delightful - we had the three course set menu, including the royal wedding cake. We even got a little bag of token chocolates to take with us, which was a lovely touch. The drinks flowed and we had an absolutely fantastic anniversary; and it was down to the incredible location and views, the food, the fabulous atmosphere and the amazing staff. Thank you! We will be back again for sure.

title: Top-Notch-View with perfect Gin-Cocktails
comment: Very attentive employees which want to help in every way to offer a great service. We had a couple of Cocktails up at the Bokan-Terasse (40th floor) with it's incredible view over London

title: Amazing view
comment: I read a few other reviews, and while some people think this is 'out of the way', I think it's great to find a nice place like this in other locations than just central London. We came here for drinks on a weekday afternoon (without booking), and were greeted by a host who showed us a window table. The waiter then showed us the cocktail menu, and gave us recommendations. Drinks are expensive, but that's expected with this kind of view. Service was great, and we had a lovely time. Will definitely be back!

title: One if the best restaurants and bar in London
comment: I’ve been living in London for over three years, visited most of the “hip” bars in both West End and Shoreditch, and I can easily say that it is one of the best places in town. Bokan is amazing because of the incredible view of the city, delicious gourmet food and banging house music tunes. It is in the beautiful area of Canary Wharf so the crowd is pleasant and it is also not so busy - there is plenty of room across the three floors. Must go!! Thanks to the lovely host Ventsislava provided nothing but the best experience.

title: Great views, not service
comment: First of all the views of London are stunning and I wanted to pop by for a quick glass of wine on a Friday evening to show my friend the wonderful view. After waiting, and waiting at the bar I finally got served after 20 minutes. I ordered two glasses of wine (circa £7.50 each) and was told it was not available and would I like a similar Pinot Noir. I agreed and was charged £25.88 for the privalidge.  I don't really think that's on and charging 12.5% service for people getting their own drinks is frankly ridiculous.

title: Excellent Brunch
comment: Firstly, it was cool up there and a great escape from the hot London summer we’re having!  Next, the views are amazing. Given I live near Canary Wharf it is intriguing to get a bird’s eye view of the local area from 38 floors up.  Brunch was the usual Londin ‘unlimited’ (but not really unlimited, since it’s only 2 hours) Prosecco thing! Food was great and enough and staff were super attentive and friendly. Best thing was it was quiet on the day we went... maybe because summer holidays had kicked in and everyone has left the city. Fine by me!!! Stay away, I say. London feels much more tolerable during summer breaks and on any of the bank holidays.

title: Good food!
comment: Nice food and excellent view. Prices are reasonable for a suchlike location. Service friendly but understaffed. I recommend the burger.

title: Great food to equal an amazing view
comment: How is this restaurant not on the list of best views in town?! The food and service was terrific. A big plus was that it felt to be a popular haunt for locals which meant that it wasn't swamped with only tourists. I got there early and was seated immediately without a reservation. The staff were really professional and swift in their service. Definitely highly recommend.

title: Consistently excellent
comment: Our third visit did not disappoint, once again. The food is wonderfully presented and with generous portion sizes. The view is fantastic and the staff are always very friendly. We will be back!

title: What a view!
comment: Beautiful venue in the earth of canary wharf. Definitely go there if you wanna enjoy a nice drink on the top of Canary wharf!

title: Great for drinks
comment: Sky bar situated in the Novotel. Brilliant view over London, especially the sunset. Lots of comfortable places to sit, with very welcoming staff. Reasonably priced wines, with a good varied selection. Would definitely return.

title: Maybe the most incredible dining experience of my life.
comment: Friday 29th June may just have been the most incredible day of my life and The Bokan played a very large part in making this happen, particularly the restaurant manager, who regrettably i did not catch the name of in all of the excitement. I had planned a day out for my now Fiance's birthday and to her knowledge it was simply a day to celebrate just that. I however had other plans, that would see me propose to her and catch her completely unaware.  I called the restaurant earlier in the week to ask them if they could help me make this proposal special by giving me access for a brief period of time to the roof terrace. On my first call it did not sound too promising, but after calling a second time, i was told that our server on the day would allow me to view the platform for a short period of time and during this i would be able to pop the question, whilst looking over the simply incredible view of London that The Bokan has to offer.  I was still slightly unsure how this would pan out but i had everything else ready, the ring had been purchased, the after-celebrations were in place - I just needed to keep the surprise under wraps and hope that our server on the day would pull through in helping me to co-ordinate things perfectly.  On arrival we assumed with reading the brunch menu and immediately had our glasses filled with prosecco, to my very nervous delight.  Between enjoying perhaps the most delicious and exquisite 3 course meal i have ever had the pleasure of eating, i found a moment to speak to the manager (our server) in private and discussed my phone calls earlier in the week. He very quietly assured me that he had received my request and after our meal he would offer us both a 'tour' of the bar and the roof terrace, which was not scheduled to open until 5pm onwards.  We finished our desserts and the moment arrived.. my palms started to clam. It was time for me to pull through on my part of the deal. The Manager (who had been welcoming and hilariously funny throughout, might i add) asked my fiance and i if we would like to take a tour, as it was our first time in The Bokan.  He proceeded to take us upstairs and we looked through the bar's windows to see the view of the o2, he then asked my Fiance if she would like to see the roof terrace. She was very excited, as was I.  We got to the roof terrace and the restaurant Manager said to us that if we liked we could spend some time here to take in the views, take photos etc and then left us to enjoy the moment.  My then Girlfriend looked at me with a very puzzled but ecstatic face and asked me why i thought he was being so incredibly nice to us in particular. It was time for me to explain the reason for this...  I dropped to one knee and told her exactly what she meant to me and the rest is history: SHE SAID YES! :D Moments later, after the screams of happiness and tears had ensued, the Manager had re-appeared with 2 glasses and an ice bucket of prosecco in the other.  He congratulated us and assured us that we could take our time and enjoy the terrace for a while longer, as we took in the moment. The gods were seriously in my favour that day, as the weather was magnificent and i really cannot serve justice to the views on offer, with my limited vocabulary. I'd like to thank everyone at The Bokan for helping me to orchestrate this special moment in our lives so perfectly and for going above and beyond.  I recommend this restaurant to anyone and all the better if you are looking to celebrate a special occasion. we will certainly be returning for the brunch in the future and i will be telling the story of how you helped me to nail my proposal plans.  Lastly, i want to apologise again that i was unable to catch the restaurant Manager's name as i of course had a lot on my mind that day, but he was just incredible throughout. We wanted to thank him personally but by the time we came to leaving, he was on his break and not in the building.  I hope the next time that we visit i can see him again and thank him personally for his help that day.  As far as fine dining in London goes, it will be very hard to top the experience that The Bokan provides. Thanks again and kindest regards Lincoln

title: BEST BAR EVER!
comment: I stayed at the Canary Wharf hotel the week of July 1 on a visit from America and the entire experience was fantastic. Tim and his staff were great but the highlight was easily the Bokan. I spent a good chunk of time there each day during the week and the service was always amazing. Peter and his team were all super professional, but the Star of the show, and my personal favorite bartender (now friend!) was Liam. If you ever visit this bar, do yourself a favor and have Liam serve you. The guy is a beast at his craft and made some of the best drinks I've had in my life. Liam was a huge part of the trip's success so definitely request him if you stay there, he's hilarious! My friend and I loved him so much we even got a pic with him! (see attached)

title: Superb view
comment: Great Location and superb views. Staff are great and excellent Cocktails and Drinks. worth getting near window

title: Amazing Business Dinner at Bokan!
comment: I had the pleasure to work with the Bokan Team last week to organise a Business dinner with 20 VIP guests. I would like to congratulate the Chef for her excellent and creative food and the Service Team who did an amazing job for us! The wine selection with the tasting menu was just perfrect! Special Thanks to the Maitre d'Hôtel Jérôme who was a Perfect Partner. He took care of all of us with a lot of professionalism and made everything possible to please us.  I strongly recommend this new restaurant in Canary Wharf.  On top of all the above compliments I must say that the view from the Bokan restaurant is a "must see"! Many thanks again for this lovely and tasty evening!

title: Tremendous restaurant
comment: Best to book for dusk when the sun is setting on a clear night. Ask for a table next to the window. Food is outstanding.

title: Hotel buffet breakfast
comment: Breakfast meeting at Bokan with some colleagues. Excellent views over London from such a high floor. Breakfast was buffet style. Reasonable selection. I enjoyed the fruit salad. Had Rooibos tea which was excellent.

title: Wonderful Experience
comment: This restaurant is at the top of the Novotel which is just a little away from the main area of Canary Wharf so it takes a bit of finding but is worth it. We started with drinks on the roof terrace on the 38th floor which is amazing, especially as it was a clear, sunny evening. The atmosphere is fun and lively and of course the view is breathtaking. We had the Tasting Menu with paired wines and enjoyed every mouthful with special mention for the Salmon with mint & pea velouté. Service was good with friendly young staff and, although it was busy, it was still possible to hold a conversation across the table. We were there quite a long time and enjoyed every minute. Highly recommended

title: BAR AND VIEWS STOP OFF
comment: Great location . Very nice views and the service from staff outstanding. Friendly and welcoming .  We visited for drinks reasonable price for a hotel and super strong so not watered down drinks here ! Very nice and worth the money Will definitely be returning sometime soon but will make sure we reserve a table but we didn't have any trouble finding a table Thanks for the great service.

title: Great Bar - Brilliant views
comment: Bokan looks like not very much from street level but the roof-top bar - 39 floors up - at night delivers the wow factor big time!! We arrived late when the bar was about to close (and were not as well dressed as other clients!!) but were still made welcome and ended a stressful day in very memorable surroundings. We have been to various roof-top bars but this one showing off London at night, rates very, very highly!

title: Dinner
comment: The view over London was amazing especially as the sun was setting. The ambiance had a buzzy vibe and the staff were efficient. The menu wasn’t vast but what was available was adequate. I would definitely go here again for drinks but not sure if i would for dinner

title: Our 2nd visit - another fantastic meal with amazing service
comment: Amazing, Amazing, Amazing....  We had the tasting menu with the matching wine as it was a special occassion. The food was stunning, the service was fantastic and the sommelier actually had the patience to explain to 2 non wine connoisseurs without us feeling stupid as to why he had chosen the wines that we were served. We drank wines we would not normally have which opened our eyes to some different options.  We had a stunning table with a stunning view over the Thames. We asked to have a little more time between courses and we didn't feel rushed, so we could enjoy the food and wine plus be able to have some time to talk. We will be back. If I could give this restaurant 6 out of 5 I would!!

title: The views make this place
comment: Bokan is a laid-back with a warm wood/industrial interior - with views spanning up and down the Thames. There's a bar on one floor, and restaurant below. The menu is compact (I've been there 3 times in 3 months and the menu is the same). The chef favours undercooked fish, but will cook meat to your taste. The vegetarian options are tasty and include cheese, but I think a vegan may struggle to find something unless the restaurant is advised in advance. Definitely a place to go - if you don't eat, hang out in the bar.

title: Mesmerising views..!
comment: A recommended place to be,have a cocktails and some food to.  Nice ambient, with singer and live band.  They have a huge liquor display,a bit disappointed about the cocktails timing arrived to table.  Cocktails level. 6/10.

title: Great place
comment: Always great cocktails and a wonderful staff ! The view over the city is simply breathtaking!!! I would definitely recommend more music variety !

title: Delicious food with amazing views
comment: I was invited for a business dinner to this awesome restaurant with a pub and and terrace with astonishing views over the City  The dishes presentation - stunning, excellent Service - more than professional, knowledgeable and pleasant staff  Food - amazing taste and selection of dishes  It was a great overall experience

title: Great location
comment: Best thing about Bokan was the lovely Antonella super service  Food and bar snacks great  G&T are fantastic

title: Simply the best!
comment: I have been here a few times now and Chef Aurelie and her team always cook simply the best food! Without a doubt the best food in Canary Wharf and some of the best in London.

title: Friday evening cocktails
comment: A wonderful gem near Canary Wharf in a Novotel. No really inside a Novotel. It is on a really high floor with fantastic panaromic views of London. Much more reasonable than the shard and great cocktails. We had a moijto and a rhubarb version. Pictures attached. Abt £12 each plus 12.5% service charge. The duty manager is crazy and funny. We asked could we sit on a reserved table by the window. He said let me check. Let’s call a friend like on who wants to be a millionaire. Then after a few funny comments gave us our table. We were served by a lovely Italian lady and service was great and almost endearing. If you visit Canary Wharf or just want to have a wonderful view and not pay shard prices then come here.

title: Delicious food but stressing atmosphere
comment: My family and I stayed at the hotel and went eating at the restaurant our last evening.  Upstairs a party was going on (The restaurants is in more than one floor) so there’s was pretty noisy but that happens... But the servers was really stressibg and ran around (no seriously ran). The kitchen is semi open and they garnished the food on both side of the kitchen counter. I DONT think this is very appealing it was almost like you sad in there busy kitchen,,, Beside the party the restaurant was very noisy too The decoration is kind of hip and hipster. Pretty cool maybe a bit dark if it hasn’t been for the window walls. I don’t say I didn’t like it. Don’t say I love it. It’s a matter of personal taste and I’m pretty neutral about the decorating.  We waiting way to long on our food - I think they were sending plates kind of slowly out of the kitchen in general... Most of the waiters did not talk very good English and had a heavy accent (maybe French?)  But I must admit the food was really good! Got to staters cause no mains seems appealing to me. I will put the pictures up.  (The menu hasn’t changed in a long time) I must also mention the view! It is stunning!! You can see so much of London! Even London eye. It is turning the other way if the big skyscrapers so again it is an amazing view! (Just like the hotel rooms’) I would maybe say it worth a visit for the food and the view!

title: Great food, great vibe, ok food
comment: I ate here with my wife and friends. Found the views breathtaking and the vibe lively in the bar, whilst relaxed in the restaurant - perfect. The food was ok and reasonably priced. It is a restaurant with amazing views, but next time I'll return just for drinks and the view.

title: Gread food, amazing views with a terrible experience !
comment: Yesterday 06/08/2018 we booked a table of 3 under my name,George Capita.We arrived there,2 nice bulgarian girls were all smile and happy to show us the table.So far so good. We decided to take the tasting menu with wine pairing because my friend had that before and he said is amazing and so it was.The food was beautifully cooked and tasty.  Until something shocking happened.The waitress spills a full glass of red wine on my Hugo Boss white jeans and my Dior shirt and ruined my night. The head waiter ,Constantin came to say sorry and he was very nice and he decided to drop the service charge from the bill but still we had to pay a bill of more then £300. We supposed to go to bar in the area after the restaurant but I had to take a uber 1 hr and 30 min back home in north so I can change .

title: The absolute best!!!
comment: I booked a table of 6 for my aunt's 70th. There was a slight confusion on arrival but that was cleared up. Staff allowed us to sprinkle confetti on the table to decorate and attach 2 helium balloons to her chair.  The food was beautifully presented and the taste was EXCELLENT. We had a great evening, staff were welcoming and attentive, decor was nice, the panoramic view was simply beautiful from the 37th floor and the overall ambience was nothing short of perfect. My aunt was made a fuss off and would I go again? OF COURSE!!!

title: A truly wonderful experience!
comment: A really welcoming sky bar with fantastic 360 views across the whole of London - great service with very friendly staff! We always bring our various friends here when they visit from overseas, and they are always, without fail, stunned by the experience. Thank you Sky Bar at Bokan for giving us so many good and happy memories.

title: Wonderful food and splendid views
comment: Was on a bit of a hunt to find somewhere interesting to eat with the family while staying at the Hilton Canary Wharf. TripAdvisor came through for me. Would have never guessed that such an outstanding restaurant would be part of a Novotel. Restaurant is on the 37th floor, bar on the 38th floor and rooftop open air lounge on the 39th. All with great views back to central London.  The food was amazing. We had the tasting menu and kids picked just an entree. 1 or 2 courses a bit heavy on the creamy sauces for my taste, but flavors all good nonetheless. Service was super attentive. Can highly recommend this for a romantic dinner as well as after work drinks on the roof with some colleagues.

title: Excellent Bar
comment: I visited this bar whilst staying in the hotel below the bar itself is located on he rooftop of a hotel in the middle of docklands the views are amazing and the staff excellent, although the bar is on the rooftop the temperature is ideal

title: Great views
comment: A fantastic location occupying the top 3 floors of the Novotel in Canary Wharf.  The interiors are very cool, think of modern post-industrial New York lofts, you get that sense of style immediately as you enter the lifts that what appear to be made out of rusty metal box but are instead lined in a luxury thick wallpaper.  The restaurant is on the 37th Floor. We are welcomed with a smile and escorted to our table. the views are great. The food is uncomplicated but sophisticated in its presentation. The grilled octopus is delicious and goes surprisingly well with the served ricotta.The rump is decent but not exceptional. After dinner we move to the 38th floor bar for some drinks. Over the next 2hrs I drink 2 negroni and I was a bit disappointed that each time it came garnished differently. The roof top terrace on the 39th floor has amazing views across the city but curiously you are not allowed to carry drinks from the bar. All in all, a great place and one I am happy to go back to over and over again.

title: I've been so many times
comment: I always visit Bokan because I am simply impressed with the views - they are stunning. We always walk-in and very kind reception ladies try to accommodate and find a table for you. 6 of us went to the restaurant a couple of weeks ago and had an amazing time - bill was £500 but we had great food, amazing wine. However, let me tell one very important thing - bar team and waitress are always rude (not restaurant's). I never complained to any of the managers but I cannot hide it anymore. The last time I went there - we were 3 ladies and ordered a bottle of wine. The waitress brought 2 glasses only but and I kindly asked to get 1 more glass (obviously). We waited for 15 minutes but there was no one and still didnt get the glass. I went to the bar, no one paid any attention. Then I found the same waitress and again KINDLY asked to get an empty glass because we are 3. She was so arrogant and started to show her embarrassment by saying: "I told you that I'm bringing it." I cannot believe.. I said I cant wait any longer because it has been more than 15 minutes! Then she was putting an order to the till and just ignored me completely. I turned to the bar and waited for anyone to look at me and requested a glass by raising my voice: PLEASE Is anyone can pass me an empty glass? It was such an awkward situation.... After 25 minutes we finally had a possibility to enjoy our wine. Next time I tried to get a recommendation about Riesling wine which they used to have on the old drinks menu. The bartender didn't show any interest in even trying to find my taste. And there is always issues with the bar team and this particular floor - I don't understand why? General manager and restaurant manager need to look into this as I can see from the other reviews - it's happening very often. I think they are all demotivated or tired. To be honest with you, I will try to look for another good place in Canary Wharf on the top floor (didnt try any of other yet) because of this bar and team's attitude as I can't bother anymore - it always changes my mood.

title: Pricey
comment: We went with friends on a Saturday evening after a few other ‘premium bars’ in town and I have to that the entrance was nice, stylish and classy without being too pretentious then the view is amazing! You can right over London with its lights and skyline so well worth it. The bar itself is decent and well in line with others in town although the service can be slow and the cocktails are at best almost half the size of anywhere I’d been during the day yet the priciest I’ve seen in quite a while. But this is London and your basically paying for one of the best views....... a comment I will make to the detriment is that we were twice approached by ladies of a ‘working disposition’ this didn’t make the ladies in our group comfortable. Nice but pricey is my shortened review.

title: Really bad food poisoning
comment: Would not touch with a 10 foot pole. Yes, the view is great (assuming you're there on a good day). But the service was painfully slow (took them 45 mins to get our food out after taking orders) and you could tell the staff would much rather be elsewhere. When the food arrived, it was... below average. Not even average. At least, that was the case for me (I had a fried salmon... it seemed like their twist on fish and chips but the flavours were not a good combo, shall we just say). Now if you asked my fiance, the response is more like "the food was horrible" because he got a terrible case of food poisoning that very evening, after the lunch we had there. We didn't have anything else unusual that day so that lunch at Bokan was the likeliest culprit. His food poisoning was so bad he had a fever and missed two whole days of work afterwards. Long story short: not worth the pain and never going back again.

title: Stunning bar, super atmosphere, great service
comment: My friends and I went to Bokan bar,  really amazing place in Canary Wharf, the view is stunning and the bar has a wide choose of spirits and cocktails. I would like to take the opportunity to thanks again Federico for the birthday cake surprise and to be so welcome to us. We will definitely come back soon  Highly recommended.

title: Pricey drinks but you get a great view of the London skyline.
comment: Amazing views of London's Skyline. Worth the premium price on the drinks as you can see the city of London all lit up while you enjoy a drink. Of course make sure to pick a night without fog or rain.

title: Lovely rooftop bar with Canary Wharf view!
comment: Was here during bank holiday weekend, it was perfect! From the food to cocktails selection, the staff were very friendly and welcoming! The bottomless brunch is a good choice to celebrate the weekend, the rooftop bar is great for private hire such as office / party! The view is amazing, especially when the sun shines in London! Definitely highly recommended and hope to come back soon!

title: Birthday
comment: My wife found this little gem for our birthdays and it was brilliant. Unfortunately the weather was not good but otherwise the view would be fantastic. We were very well looked after by the staff and manager. The drinks and bar food was very very good. Definately recommend this place and we will visit again soon. Thank to all the staff for making this a memorable occasion.

title: Super friendly service
comment: Bokan is a great spot in London. The view is amazing, and even going to to toilet there is Instagrammable. We wanted to go there for experience, but it was thanks to Antonella that the night was unforgettable. Her service was really friendly and welcoming, and made Bokan seem much more approachable than we though it would be. Definitely looking forward to coming back, especially if she is working!

title: Great view. Overpriced food
comment: Me and my friend staying at Novotel, heard great reviews on bokan. When me and my friend got to the restaurant ordered our food and drinks.  We where enjoying the amazing views with the drinks we had ordered but where still waiting for the salmon fish and sweet potato fries and Mac and cheese. After 40min waiting for the food we got our mains, just couldn't believe £17 for two small pieces of salmon and small bucket of fries and my friend got his Mac and cheese which had more courgette than anything and was burnt on the sides, looked like a microwaved meal given to my friend.  Really enjoyed the views but the food overpriced for small portions, i sent an email to complain but have not received any reply.

title: Really good views, quite good service
comment: Great rooftop in London. Good service and quality food enjoying really good views. Highly recommended experience.

title: Appalling, inept service
comment: Visited as part of office group and service was appalling. Order was taken and laboriously handwritten onto a sheet of paper, then tsrnascripted into the order till. Bar staff are "supposed" to print off order and prepare and then waiting staff relay to table. Simples?! Except the wrong drinks were transposed, the bar staff didn't bother to print off order, waiting staff didn't bother to check that it had been started on even after a number of queries about delays and the non-alcoholic cocktails were served with alcohol. And that was after a 55 minute wait. Next round marginally better - except this time the insisted on alcohol free drink (Tequila Sunrise - without tequila) taook 45 minutes to arrive. Lovely venue but a classic case of style over substance. Beyond parody

title: Fantastic location; seriously let down by service
comment: Location and venue amazing - 5 stars - but really let down by poor bar service, particularly by one of the staff on this evening who appeared to discriminate against certain customers in favour of others. He was rude, inept and really tarnished what was a lovely night at a spectacular location. What a shame.

title: Evening at Bokan
comment: I've been in Bokan for a friend meeting and I need to say that the place was amazing. Not only for the view but also for the great waitress Antonella who served us. Professional and kind. The food is incredible and drinking with your friends with a London view can create a nice atmosphere. Recommended.

title: Love this place
comment: I visited several times, love the Sunday jazz afternoons on the rooftop.  I only had drinks here but will definitely try the restaurant too.

title: Nice views but service could be better
comment: We visited Bokan as part of our stay at the Novotel. The Bar offers stunning views of the city and is modern and has a good atmosphere. We visited the bar for drinks on Saturday night and our main criticism would be that the security staff were very rude indeed. We were told that we could not go up to the roof terrace as it was closed, despite the fact that other couples and individuals were going upstairs. The last orders were around 2330. A polite and pleasant member of the bar staff approached us and asked if we wanted anything else, but then around half an hour later, the same rude bouncer approached us and abruptly said “Same goes for you guys, we close at 1am and we want you done and out”. Not even an ‘excuse me’.  Unfortunately, this individual’s attitude ruined our experience. He was unnecessarily rude and abrupt. Other than that it was a pleasant bar with good staff, but let down by poor security.

title: Dinner
comment: Superb Saturday evening out! I met my friends at Bokan and our table was next to the window. As it was a clear sunny day, the views across London were spectacular during daylight and night time. All three of us loved it. The staff gave us a warm welcome and looked after us very well throughout our visit. Their knowledge about the food and wine pairing was very good. We went for the tasting menu which was amazing. It was a successful evening and cannot wait to go there again. Thank you.

title: One amazing dinner
comment: Absolutely cannot speak highly e Pugh about this restaurant on top of Novotel hotel Canary Wharf. Food was absolutely incredible. Service impeccable and the views over London incredible. We absolutely loved the incredible flavours of the food. A must try.

title: Perfect
comment: Me and my girlfriend visited this bar on a Friday afternoon- I would recommend booking a table so you ensure you sit by the window to get the best views. The drinks are in the higher price bracket but well worth it. The staff were brilliant, table service and fizz/wine top ups when you have a bottle. We ordered chips, olives and focaccia with hummus and they were lovely and decent sized portions. Our waiter knocked one of our glasses over and immediately requested a new full glass to the table. All round great experience, will definitely be returning!

title: Outstanding place
comment: The food is absolutely delicious with local products, the view of the city is astonishing, always had a warm welcome and service from the staff, the cocktails are inventive and the style and decoration is very trendy. I love this place, coming here as often as possible and never ever disappointed.

title: Bar service
comment: Horrible service!!! I wais waiting for 40 minuets to order one drink when the bar was totally empty...

title: My favorite place in London so far.
comment: I have been living for quite a while in London and have been to several restaurant but Bokan is by far my favorite place.  The view is simply amazing and I just can not get bored of it. The staff is all the time really friendly and helpful. Guillaume is the one to ask when advises are needed, professional and knowledgeable on every aspects.  Jerome is the one you want to talk to when wanting to laugh for a while. He always know what to say to make a big smile appear on everyone’s face.  The cooking is Mediterranean style, with the French touch that makes the dishes delicious. Aurelie, the French Chef, is always ready to come and answer questions. She is really passionnate and you can feel it when eating her dishes. I have recommended Bokan to a lot of my friends and I will come again everytime opportunities appear.  Thanks Bokan, those 5 stars are what you deserve !

title: Poor service
comment: Our order could not have been less complicated. 3 coffees with soya milk (bcause of allergy)... At first, it turned out that they just simply forgot to prepare. When I asked, we had to wait for another 30 mins and then guess what.. we got 3 cold coffees with normal milk!! We decided not to give 'Terrible' overall rating because after our (semi-loud) complain to the restaurant manager they re-made the coffees and also made it complimentary.

title: Great drinks with a view which deserves a toast
comment: On my three visits to Bokan I've had a great experience. In terms of location the bar, restaurant and rooftop terraces all offer amazing views across the city overlooking many of the capital's landmarks. The environment is modern and comfortable and our host Veni ensured we found an ideal location from a choice of available spaces. The selection of beers and wines available is extensive and the team demonstrated their deep knowledge to make recommendations which exceeded our expectations. I haven't had the opportunity to dine at Bokan yet but look forward to this with the options on offer. If you want a highlight to your visit to London Docklands Bokan comes highly recommended.

title: Cannot fault
comment: I came here with my best friend to celebrate a birthday. The menu was amazing and as a pescatarian there was still plenty of seafood and Veg options to chose from. At first glance the prices look a bit expensive ( I’m a student so don’t have a big budget) but when the food arrives you know why it’s priced. I’ve never eaten food with so much flavour before, it was totally worth the money. And the service was amazing, every member of staff made us feel so welcome. Not to mention my friend was given a birthday treat with a selection of mini desserts and a little pastry/ cake to go.  Planing on returning later in the year

title: Amazing Diner !
comment: Amazing diner, Amazing view, the rooftop are really cool! Perfect for romantic diner or after work with mate  highly recommended !  Thanks to the chef  JP

title: Service slightly slipping downward
comment: I’ve been here many times since it first opened, previous visits have been fantastic, however last night was a bit below par, we had bar food which took quite a while to come out and was staggered, also the waiter was a tad aggressive with his response to incorrect orders insisting that he was right despite the 3 of us saying “no that’s not what we asked for”  The customer should always be right, on this occasion we were No need to follow up with emails just talk to your staff on the finer points of diplomacy  Push the standard up don’t let it slip!

title: Heaven does excit on the 37th floor!!
comment: This is probably the one must visit place of London in 2018!! at the top of this hotel is a hidden restaurant called Bokan. The chef has a serious background of fine dining restaurant and you'll will sample a fantastic revisited French diner. The tasting menu is a very good value for money and gives you the chance to try some of the chef signature dishes Not to miss the exeptionnal view of London to discover one by one all the famous building when night falls on the city. Great service from a professional team Thank you for such a special evening

title: Amazing views and excellent food
comment: I have been here twice now - first in July 2017 and then again in Dec17 and I know I will keep coming back again. Whether it’s in summer when you can watch the sun set over the London scene or whether in winter when the sparkling lights of London and the meandering Thames becomes your backdrop to an amazing evening, Bokan never fails to impress. Surprisingly, the cocktails are reasonably priced and each and every seat in the restaurant has a amazing view - hell even the bathroom sink’s view doesn’t disappoint. The food is great - if I had to pick a few, I would say the beef carpaccio, the rack of lamb and the summer berries cheese cake are a must. Above all, what this place offers is a beautiful setting to have a romantic evening or a place to wind down after a long week.

title: Amazing Saturday evening
comment: Love Bokan!  We came here at 6pm, the girls at the reception were really nice (Bulgarian girls) they give us seats straight from the door  One of my favourite bars in this area. Great service as usual. The view.... sensational...

title: Overall poor
comment: Overall a poor experience, we were three mates looking for quick dinner before going out. Arrived at the restaurant on the 38th floor, there was no hostess to be seen for at least 5 minutes and no one had greeted us, so we decided to make our way to the restaurant which is a floor below, once we got there again there was no one to greet us. After wondering around the restaurant a waiter appeared we asked if we could have a table for three. His response was you need to go back upstairs to the hostess desk and they will allocate you a table. Once we got upstairs there was a lady which didn't seem too happy to see. Anyway she brought us to the table. Once at the table we ordered some wine and main courses, friends ordered a fish I ordered steak medium rare. Drinks arrived fast and the waitress was very good, however once the main courses arrived steak was cooked well done. I immediately said it to the waitress however her response was you asked it like this however I will change it, it took some time for my plate to be taken back to the kitchen. While I was waiting for my steak to be redone my mates were enjoying their cod which they mentioned was very good, while they were eating a team of waiters began breaking down one of the communal tables, while this was happening one of the tables fell to the floor making a load noise and getting all of the restaurant to turn around. This was not an appropriate time to be breaking down tables while the restaurant was still half full. There was no presence of management at all. Once my food was ready I could see it on the counter, with severel people touching it with their fingers to see if it's cooked properly. (the only person touching it should be the chef). Once the food arrived waitress was very sympathetic and apologised for the mistake. However no manager checked if it was okay. Once my food arrived my mates were already finished their meal and we're in a rush to go. Also the side of fries that was ordered with the original meal was not changed and was left on the table so once my replacement meal arrived they were already stone cold. Anyway overall poor service, limited menu, however has a lot of potential with the right management.

title: Excellent Breakfast
comment: On a clear day the view is fantastic! The breakfast was excellent and dinner was very good. The night we ate at the restaurant, it was very busy and the service was very slow.

title: Worth your time !
comment: I just came back from a nice evening at Bokan. You need to have a budget but you get the unusual view, a nice atmosphere, an interesting deco, a choice of surprising cocktails and the service; Antonella did add a bit of spice to our evening as she combined professionalism with a relaxing sense of humour, a cheerful side and an easy-going way. Happy to enjoy it again. Philippe.

title: Great Food / Atmosphere
comment: I visited Bokan for dinner one night while staying at the Novotel (different review).  The menu was very modern European and a little different than I was used to as an American traveler that prefers traditional American food - I know, I need to expand my horizons.  I wound up having a sirloin and mashed potatoes and they were both very good. The best thing about this experience were the servers - two people worked as a team (guy and a girl) and were fun, happy, enjoyed their job and really made our experience a memorable one. Just super friendly, attentive and professional staff. Couldn’t ask for more. This restaurant is on the 37/38 floor of the Novotel. The views of greater London are fantastic. It’s worth stopping by just to see the view.

title: Great dining experience
comment: I went again to Bokan having had a great dinner a couple of months ago. I booked to celebrate my mom's birthday. We went for the tasting menu. Everything was delicious and well executed. Service was great, fast and personalised. They even gave us a small cake with a candle as a treat. Would definitely go again, and you should too.

title: Mixed Bag - not great if you have allergies
comment: I was staying in the hotel so reception kindly booked me a table. I stated I had food intolerances upon booking and this was noted. I was greeted and shown to a table and although initially service was attentive I was not given guidance on allergens in the menu and I had to try ordering a few options until I got one I could have. I would have expected the waiter to be more clued up on allergens and to be more helpful. It’s not like it’s a cheap restaurant. When my steak came the meat was cooked medium rare as requested but it wasn’t a good piece of meat and was quite chewy. I’m from a farming family so I know good steak and that wasn’t the quality I’d expect at a restaurant of this calibre. Something had been excluded from the dish due to my gluten intolerance but that had not been pointed out when I ordered. So, great that it was omitted however this should have been mentioned at the time of ordering. The “Amuse Bouche” was just brought to me and I had to request the waiter check the ingredients before I had it - again disappointing. I actually felt like I was a pain to the servers because of my allergies and other tables seemed to get more attentive service as I was sat there with an empty glass for ages and being ignored. All in all, great views, nice wine list but below par steak and below par service - specifically around allergens.

title: Great view - shame about the food
comment: Went here a couple of days ago and has the tasting menu. Whilst the drinks were great and the views fabulous the food was disappointing. In one dish, coffee overpowered an over cooked and underwhelming piece of veal. In another grey dish, truffle dominated a fake celeriac pasta tube. It was almost universally disliked by my party. Dessert was a drab affair; some off-the-shelf chocolate three ways.  The was only one was for me, and that was towards the exit.

title: Great place
comment: Amazing restaurant, food, atmosphere and service was outstanding. You also have great views of London city. Even the toilets are fantastic. It is pricey, so it would definitely be one of those special occasion places you go to. - the lamb main was some of the best lamb I’ve had.

title: Its becoming a family like experience
comment: So, those who know me, known how much I LOVE Bokan at Novotel hotel! Coffee ☕, mid day lunches , mid day drinks, late night drinks , jazz evenings , friends reunions️, dates or just chilled afternoons are so far just a few reasons for why I keep ending up on that 38th floor with all them stunning views.  The best part of it all- it's becoming almost like visiting a family. Except you obviously have to pay at Bokan... haha! Team is genuinely what makes my every single time so much more exciting and so much better. Veni and Teodora are usually two faces meeting you the moment you step out of elevator and God is it a gorgeous duo! And then there's this young gentleman, who's name I still can't remember for some reason, sorry ( he's having his haircut in Canary Wharf ), but he's your guy if you want not only a good service, but also to explore some of the best cocktails!  In summary, I could probably be Bokan's ambassador by now, but I know how important and nice it is to hear about good experiences, not only negative ones. Trust there are not many of those though. Thank you guys

title: Delicious
comment: We stayed at the hotel and booked a table before,which I feel is a must as this bar is very very busy. Upon arrival we had welcoming that was warm and relaxing. Shown to the table by the window which has amazing views over London. The waitress was friendly and really really knew her cocktails. I had the burger and was so so delicious and cooked exactly how I wanted it. My wife had the mac and cheese. Now I’m not into M and C but tasted this and really enjoyed the bit I had. Presentation was excellent and the meals where reasonable price for London. We spent most of the night having cocktails and really didn’t want to leave the table as you feel relaxed here and just ended up enjoying ourselves that much. The price was right for all the food and drinks. Definitely will return and hopefully have another excellent meal and drinks.  Just to say thank you to our waitress who made the night a special one on her knowledge and friendliness.

title: It’s not a dinner it’s an experience !!!!
comment: We went to Bokan on a Friday night to invite some friends over for dinner and impress them with the kitchen of Chef Aurelie Altemaire! Once again again we were amazed by the unique flavours and textures of her dishes. From the starter to the dessert it’s a journey of surprise and different tastes that will not disappoint you. It’s a place I would definitely recommend if you want to treat yourself or impress someone. The service and the location are an added value to this amazing culinary experience!

title: Breakfast, Lunch & Dinner
comment: This is a breathtaking place that you must visit if ever in this area of London. While the time of day does not matter, you would be amazed by the view of the skyline at night.  Go and have a drink!

title: Mediocre...
comment: Came here on a Saturday around 8 for dinner with my boyfriend, and my review in a nutshell: Views - 5/5 Service - 2.5/5 Food - 3/5 Without the views... this restaurant is mediocre and not worth the prices. We had to wait 20 minutes for the starters - crab and octopus... the crab had way too much going on and wasn't that great. The octopus was very bland and very disappointing. The steak however was fantastic - the only thing I would say is order one above how you normally like it. My boyfriend asked for rare and got it blue, I asked for medium rare and it came rare ... even though it came different to how We asked, we still ate it as it was a fantastic steak. The service is appalling! A few of the staff members weren't the friendliest, and seemed to try and get you out as quick as possible. One of the waitresses kept coming over to our table asking if we were finished - she could clearly see we were still eating and done that for both the starter and main.  If you did want to visit here, I'd recommend visiting for drinks at the bar to admire the views. I wouldn't recommend the restaurant. It is highly overpriced and the food isn't fantastic.

title: Great hotel, fancy restaurant!
comment: We were staying last weekend in Novotel Canary wharf, on Saturday night, we had table booked for two in Bokan, for my Mrs and I. The dining experience was an excellent one! The Head executive chef Aurelie, was serving and overlooking our table, everything was just spot on, also sous chef Robert was great and his team made their self's proud! Chef Istvan was serving perfectly cooked breakfast at morning buffet. Great service as well! Very friendly,positive, and attentive waiters and waitresses! Fantastic hotel and beautiful view, great staff! I can recommend this place for 100% to everyone! Thank you very much? Novotel Canary wharf, BOKAN.

title: Fantastic even before you consider the view
comment: Situated on the 37th floor of the Novotel near Canary Wharf we were expecting good quality hotel food rather than the beautifully presented and fantastic tasting fine dining experience we got. So often even at a great restaurant there will be the odd dud course but this one was perfect in every respect. By the standards of some of London's Michelin starred restaurants this is right up there and considerably better value too. The service and wines were all up to the same standard to make up a great experience with only one little complaint to stop this being perfect. Our complaint (which might be an attraction to some) is that the restaurant is a floor below the bar at the Novotel which is really quite noisy. As such do not go here if you want to enjoy a superb meal in a quiet environment. Finally, the view. Just stunning.

title: Great food with an amazing view
comment: My wife and I thoroughly enjoyed this 2nd visit to Bokan to celebrate Valentine's Day. Very warm welcome! We went for the tasting menu which was excellent. Amazing view looking West towards the City at night. Not pretentious at all. No pressure to move off the table. Strongly recommend.

title: Cocktails for every taste
comment: This place offers the best view and variety of tasty cocktails. A lot of people are visiting this bar after work

title: Pricy, good views and good for a date
comment: went for drinks. great views of London. best to search around for a place to sit or book table in advance. its in the middle of nowhere and the area is a bit dead at the weekend.  drinks were so yummy but also expensive.  lots of different types of alcohol

title: Stylish on 38th floor, but service should never...
comment: ... say „it‘s not my fault!“ when they failed to deliver drinks even after two reminder. This was disappointing. However, location is great and offers a nice view towards London City. Interior is stylish, a mixture if wood and metal.

title: Excellent in every way
comment: I recently dined with a group of 15 of us for lunch and the meal was perfect in every way. Firstly, the staff could not be more friendly and were superb in tending to the table. Secondly, the restaurant offers exceptional views which give The Shard and Heron Tower a run for their money! Finally, the food was exquisite - not only is the presentation a wow factor (every course was Insta-worthy!), but it was delicious, fresh and cooked to perfection. I would say given the quality, it is very good value for money. Thanks Bokan for a memorable lunch and we'll be back soon!

title: A couple of key points for reference
comment: Good afternoon Jeevan,  Saturday night .. 24 February . we are a couple, i am Romanian by origin, British national my boyfriend is Saudi Arabian, future husband , we had celebrated our engagement and love . Unfortunately we had a really bad experience from beginning at Bokan Bar . We came to the bar as we heard is a really good one . 1) The location is too out of reach , it means that I have to take in consideration to locate the venue . The transport is not a problem . Anyway this was not the main one reason .  2) The main reason why I do this review is when we got to the mini reception Bokan bar upstairs, we needed to greet the staff not her to greet us . She finished with the ex client taking care of their coats, etc, then we asked for a table, she was in rush saying i wlll find one for you next to the window. She went to find something, we were following her as we didnt know what to do, wait at reception or what / she stops at one table and start chit chat with that clients or friends . She forgot about us or what? we dont meean to be rude, but finally we asked her, excuse me could we have a table please ? the second time. she got nervous and said oh sorry about it , let me find then she starts moving . Finally she gave us a table opposite the bar , no view. Then she ignores us again.  Thats reception girl.  3) we ordered finally our drinks and we were happy we got the table.... till we got water x 3 times and the drinks didn't arrive. We asked for the drinks but we felt completely IGNORED We were waiting more than 25 Minutes there .  4 ) Finally we decided to leave the place... no drinks, no customer service, nothing. Most of luxury bars they serve nuts or small snack as beginning free or as from the menu and have been asked by waitress. What is missing ? The Bokan Bar is a very highly recognized Bar in London. You guys are competing with the bars and hotels around you The Pearson Room , Cinnamon restaurant Hilton, Scoff and Banter in Edwardian, etc but I have never had this kind of experience nowhere in such as 4 stars bar and Hotel . I have stayed in Dubai in Novotel, in Bahrain, and other places but never had this experience in my life. We travel a lot and stay in 5 stars hotels.  I would really want to come back but the customer service destroyed our evening.  And not the last one , we needed to spent time to get a taxi to re arrange our night out in the same time, time , energy, not good night out , money the last ... we lost .  I believe to get good customer service you need to have good waitress and waiters who works in team and for the same goal to achieve the highly customer service and make each customer happy in order a business to be run properly. if you want keep your clients and business of course . That is a priority.  very dissapointing

title: Fabulous
comment: I wasn't sure what to expect and it turned out to be fabulous! Lovely welcome, very nice and friendly staff. Amazing food and breathtaking views. I like to dine and experience different places around the world. This is definitely one of my favourites. I will be back to explore the roof top bar when the weather improves.

title: Fantastic Bar
comment: Enjoyed a night here recently. The ambiance is lovely in the bar and the views are spectacular. For those staying in the hotel this is a must visit. Great cocktails, friendly staff. All in all a great place.

title: Nice food and fantastic view on 34th floor!
comment: Open until late, great wine , delicious food! We had burgers and some amazing bread with butter before, most delicious one

title: Love love love
comment: Came here for my boyfriends birthday was staying in the hotel! gorgeous views and fab cocktails xxxx

title: Great place for a special occasion
comment: Went for dinner on Saturday night. Great experience from the first minute. The place is excellent in every aspect: breathtaking view over the river and the city, relaxing atmosphere, friendly and attentive staff, superb food. We went for the chef’s tasting menu with every course being a masterpiece. Our special thanks to the sommelier, his vision of pairing made our food journey even more exciting.

title: Won’t visit again
comment: I visited here at the weekend after a day in Canary Wharf. Whilst the view is good the novelty wears off quite quickly. The staff are so rude and I felt very uncomfortable. I didn’t like the vibe so after 30 minutes I left. I was really disappointed as I had been looking forward to the rooftop bar but based on my experience at the weekend I won’t be returning

title: Great views and food
comment: Went with a friend for dinner and tried the tasting menu which was excellent. Friendly & helpful service with some great recommendations. Decent affordable wines to pair and the salmon was spectacular. Lovely way to relax looking at the views of London.

title: Great Views
comment: Very nice setting. Went for birthday drinks and turned out having a really good time.  Attended on the evening of the lighting storm so that just made the night even better.

title: Incredible tasting menu and delightful service
comment: We booked a table at Bokan for our anniversary. It was our first time at the restaurant for both my husband and I. As I had made note of our anniversary when booking the table, the staff seated us in a private section with Thames views - very romantic! The staff were attentive, and even catered to my dietary needs during pregnancy. Course after course the flavours continued to impress! The food was divine and we cannot wait to return for another meal. Great value for such exceptional food and service. And a big thank you to Florian for making our evening that much more special!

title: Outstanding food amazing view
comment: Super high quality of food, great service and amazing view. Nevertheless what I loved is that the venue and the service is not pretentious, it feels warm confy and friendly. I went there for my birthday we took the chief dégustation menu, just superb I recommend taking the matching wines

title: Made great memories
comment: Without a doubt, Bokan is one of the most romantic places London has to offer. The view on the Thames and the whole city is breathtaking, and the informal but professional service of the floor staff makes you always feel looked after without being inappropriate or too formal. The food is greatly cooked and with a very innovative plating. It's amazing to be able to have good food made with passion in a laidback, informal place. Will talk about this dinner for a very long time.

title: Great location, Poor service
comment: Is not the first time we are going to the bar at Novotel Canary Wharf. The location and views are amazing, but the service we always find is rude and very inefficient.  They seem not happy with their job, always in rush and they have no time even for say hello when you are arriving to the place

title: Poor and slow service
comment: We want to have some drinks and food around canary wharf area, apparently Bokan is the highest bar/restaurant within the area so we decided to check it out. It takes 20 minutes for the staff to come to the table saying a "Hi" and take orders.. The whole atmosphere with the service we felt no difference than going to weatherspoon or other pubs. The food was ok, takes ages to wait for our drinks. No waiter or waitress come to ask if we need another drink. Someone finally came to clear the table after the empty plates on the table for quite long time..We decided to leave and we have to walk to the bar to ask for the bill. And we paid the bill with the full service charge while we didn't felt it was worth it. Anyway, will not recommend it to any of our clients or friends.

title: Cracking views from 38th floor
comment: Nice restaurant, service a bit impersonal but efficient. Menu limited but nice. Food presentation was outstanding and very nice.

title: Good Views but they need to work on the bookings
comment: The view is lovely, as is the food. You enter the building prime time on a Saturday afternoon and expect to see someone on the podium of the entrance but there isn't. So you have to work out for yourself how to use the lift and which floor you need to go to. We ended up in the bar, but the woman at reception couldn't understand a word we was saying. Despite us being locals. She thought we was wanting to book a table, despite us repeatedly saying "we are here for our 2pm booking". Then we was seated in the bar area at a table that was practically on the floor. I asked to be moved to a table where we wouldnt have to eat with our food on our laps. He then gave us a bar menu. We asked if we could have the brunch menu which we booked for. He said this was downstairs but the brunch was now over. I advised I had checked online and that I was sure the last SEATING for brunch was 2pm and it started at 12. However it get very confusing as he couldn't really understand what we was saying either. We were just about to leave when we checked to say are you sure we cannot have a table and he said that we could but we had to order as the kitchen takes the last orders for brunch at 2:30pm. Finally when we got around it all we had a table booked downstairs and we were able to enjoy the meal however, it was a lot of stress for us.

title: Great food
comment: I had a most enjoyable burger cooked exactly how I wanted it cooked, bravo  Wine was no more expensive than I would of paid at any bar in Canary Wharf let a lone a hotel - most enjoyable evening

title: Absolutely amazing
comment: Went to this new and beautiful place at Novotel, Boka. Absolutely amazing experience, staff is super welcoming and friendly, great cocktails and fantastic food. In fact, taking my friend for an afternoon coffee back to Boka tomorrow afternoon

title: Dinner with a view
comment: Fabulous views, delicious food stylishly presented by professional and friendly staff. As you'd expect the price is reflective of this, especially the wine-list - excellent sommelier though.

title: Best cocktails and better views than any rooftop bar!
comment: Hidden gem in the heart of canary whalf. Ditch the tall well known rooftop bars for something more unique and stunning views of the London skyline. Must try cocktail called isle chapel which tasted like a lemon meringue pudding!

title: Dinner at Bokan 37
comment: What a great place to visit. The views were on the 38/39 floors of the associated Novotel Canary Wharf and you pretty much had a wrap around view of the city. There is an outside deck area too, which will be amazing when they get the outdoor heating in place. Food was served with style and the servers were very well versed and knowledgable about the menu. He presented our plates, and explained them to us all so we knew what they were. They looked stunning and tasted even better.  As the evening progresses it starts to morph in to a bar, so you can comfortable have dinner and stay for more drinks without having to leave. Is definitely worth a 2nd visit, and a 3rd and more.

title: Incredible view, everything else average
comment: The view of London is lovely. The food is mediocre, limited choice and the service was arrogant. Very expensive, 2 courses with wine was around £75 per person. Food was rather bland.

title: Best view is at night
comment: Four of us went to Bokan. Great views at night seeing London lit up. The service was great and the food very well presented and tasted superb. The views are beautiful. Bottle of wine, 4 beers, 2 tasting menus and 2 a la carte menus with starters, main and desserts £332 so not the cheapest place to eat out on a Saturday night. Not a child friendly place really as it’s quite grown up and adult. 12.5% added automatically. Our last course was forgotten about on the tasting menu so we had to ask. No big bother really. Sweetbreads were deep fried and tasty. I think these were the pancreas gland ones due to the shape and not the thymus gland ones from the throat.

title: Dissapointed
comment: Nice view, good food, but extremely loud due to dinner party in the restaurant. At times, it was impossible to understand the people sitting in front of you. Very unfortunate, were looking forward to a nice dinner.

title: New Years Eve fun
comment: We were here for the New Years Eve 6 course tasting meal and can only praise the restaurant for the very well organised evening. The entertainment was great and the food exceptional while the staff were very friendly but also lively and fun making it a really warm atmosphere. The views across London in all directions are worth making a visit for, in themselves. Well done all involved at Bokan, we had a great time.

title: New Year's Eve at Bokan
comment: Absolutely great night service was amazing from when we arrived great table with wonderful view of the fireworks and London great service in regards to the drinks our waiter Peter was absolutely spot on and nothing was too much trouble we live local so will be back on a more regular occasion thanks Peter for starting our 2018 the way we expected see you soon

title: Christmas drinks and canapes
comment: Amazing views and ambience. Extremely attentive staff, especially Peter @ the bar. Food and drinks very good.

title: Amazing dinner
comment: Everything was perfect. From the beginning to the end . The scallops with celery and black pudding was fabulous. The view is amazing. Thanks to all the team .

title: Panoramic view is all when dining
comment: We (6 persons) dined here before Christmas. Service was good, no complaints about starters, however welcome starters were very simple for the restaurant level (warm breads with selection of butters), wine list is on a pricey side. The biggest disappointment were main course - beef entrecote ordered medium arrived completely overdone and dry. Octopus was well prepared and not gummy. Avoid the area near the open kitchen, better get seated further away because of heat. Maybe a wrong day for us to visit ? Will give it another try at Easter.

title: Wonderful view, but ...
comment: Fantastic views from the top floor of Novotel Canary wharf, looking back towards the centre of London. Ordered 2 drinks, cider and one of their cocktails, plus chips to snack. Drinks and mayonnaise/tomato sauce arrived promptly. Had our drinks, no sign of chips, waited and waited, the waitress came over to take away empty drinks, said haven't you got your chips ... no ... she went away, and they arrived soon after, so obviously forgotten about. Bill came to £26 so expensive for 2 drinks and chips.

title: Fantastic diner
comment: We had diner with 5 friends at Bokan. First of all the view is breathtaking. The service is impeccable and friendly. The sommelier is just great. We described the type of wine we enjoy and he made us discover a South African amazing wine that we all loved. Food is excellent. We all loved Bokan and will go back soon.

title: My Birthday
comment: The ONLY reason for going to this restaurant is for the view, which is really wonderful. from the top of this tower, especially at night, you have extensive views of the lights and sights of one of the great cities of the world. Enjoy this! It certainly is not the place for a romantic dinner. As far as we could figure, the highest floor comprises a bar with bookable table seating, with a limited bar menu, and VERY loud music. No conversation possible. On the floor below, down a short staircase, is the main restaurant, where we were booked. The 'music' noise from above resounds, but the volume is thankfully lower. Although is was Friday, and a couple of weeks before Christmas, this lower area was sparsely populated. This was a surprise. The menu, in our opinion, is very limited and fairly boring. The service is not too bad, but rather mechanical: eg. you are asked if you are 'enjoying' at critical points. The food is nicely and artistically presented on the plates, but too our surprise is not vey tasty. 'BLAND" is the word that came to mind. My first course was 'Octpus and Beetroot" and it was hard to get the taste of either of these components. Seemed like it had been boiled for hours. Second course was lamb which was equally 'non-lamby' in taste. The wine list was all highly priced, and from unknown vineyards. We had a Spanish wine from an area with which we are familiar. The wine was good, in that it had no bad qualities, but not much going for it either. BUT THE VIEW FROM THE RESTAURANT IS FANTASTIC. A meal for two with wine set us back £175. I rationalise this as good value, being £125 for the view and £50 for the rest.

title: Breathtaking
comment: The view is fantastic, the atmosphere with the music is warm and relaxing, the staff always there to assist in anything you might need and also lots of options on the menu and interesting cocktails. We will be back!

title: Drinks
comment: Someone recommended this bar and were were not disappointed. We went for pre dinner drinks and loved it.  The views across London are fantastic. We went on a cold crisp clear night so even better.  We sat at the bar and were served great drinks with some nuts and olives. The staff were efficient and very pleasant. Loved the decor.

title: Great views.
comment: Views are great and, in my opinion, that is the best thing this restaurant has to offer. Food was OK but the service was not good and not very profesional.

title: Solid 3*
comment: Went for drinks only. Amazing views, nice ambience, nice drinks. Thoroughly enjoyed it. That said, the service was very slow (& they struggled to actually charge us for all of our drinks...) and also our cocktails were inconsistent. The same drink ordered twice came once on the rocks and once in a martini glass. Odd. Probably the upstairs and downstairs bars were working differently...

title: Sunday brunch was lovely!!!
comment: On Sunday I have been in this lovely restaurant with my danish friend for brunch. Even though the price £49 per person, it’s worth. Firstly for extremely amazing view, second delicious food with touch of French cuisine , which I am totally in love. Also, prosecco included in the brunch menu. So, definitely will be back. By the way, staff especially receptionist Veni was extremely welcoming and polite. Many thanks for making our time even more nice. Totally in love with this place❤️❤️❤️

title: Sunday evening dinner with friends
comment: On a recommendation, we made a reservation for dinner on the 38th floor!!! Great ambience and views. Not exceptionally busy, but service was slow and laborious. Not many menu choices, but choices made. Again, service was slow and one member of party returned their main course which was cold (Not under cooked) for reheating. Overall, very disappointed.

title: Amazing views
comment: We went there for a drink on the roof bar so cannot comment on the food  We ordered 4 cocktails that was like3 sips and gone small glasses to say the least .. hey ho pay for the veiws I know that . Not much else to comment on really nice ambience as well

title: Amazing Views
comment: Great views & atmosphere  Price is £££ = Views  Service is slow, but the bartender was nice & once they get to you finally, they’re nice i guess..

title: Great views and food!
comment: Nice service too! Great cocktails.  Nice spot for a dinner and cocktails overall. If you ask for a table by the Window, they would most likely accommodate your request:) thanks Bokan! I would go back:)

title: Bellowed at over bar food
comment: I was taken there for my birthday. The restaurant was full until 9pm, and so we had to settle for the bar. The place was very dark, and finding the table was not the say (for me, anyway). The awful din emitted by a woman squealing into a microphone (they tell me that it is singing; but it has nothing in common with Covent Garden) was so loud because, apparently, it has to carry over three floors in the building. The occasional breaks which she and her organ grinders took were the best bit - I could hear what was being said to me. I was not impressed by the requirement to hand over my bank card before an order could be taken. What might have been done with it while it was out of my sight was a concern, although it seems to have been all right. Clearly, this Novotel has had more than its share of dodgy customers, although how they could escape easily from the 38th floor was a mystery to me. I was assured that the food in the restaurant is better than what is available in the bar. This view was shared by our waiter. In my view, the meal was significantly overpriced The views across London were certainly breathtaking but, apart from the wonderful company I was in, these were the best part of the evening. If I could get into the restaurant itself on a quiet night (i.e. no squealing) I might try it again, but otherwise, for me, it lies between the very disappointing and a ripoff

title: super food and view
comment: As a party of four we ate here on Friday night (3rd Nov) We were shown to a corner table with great views of London and the O2 arena. Mix up with ordering our wine meant we waited longer than we should. Also our friends had a gift card for two free drinks which the staff could not fathom!!! and therefore only one free drink arrived. The lighting was low(probably for effect) which meant we had to use our phone torch to see the menu. However the food was superb, the rib-eye and mash was to die for. One criticism, I understand that a large percentage of staff in the service industry are from overseas but a grasp of the English language would be a help. My partner always worries if the staff do not understand gluten free and it did take a while to communicate this, sorry but "I am French " is not the answer we were seeking. However she was guided through the menu (in a fashion) had a very nice meal. the gf bread rolls were delicious.

title: Mums Off duty
comment: Wow, what an amazing venue. Superb value for a bottomless prosecco brunch. The food was exquisite and the service was excellent. As soon as our glass was empty, it was topped up again. There was a great atmosphere in all the bars/restaurant and I would definitely return. The views are stunning and you even get a view in the loo! A great experience with attentive and friendly staff. Thanks!

title: Very nice place to have great view to London
comment: Very nice place to have great view to London from 36 floor Pretty cool place with ambient and some kind of atmosphere

title: Great views - Terrible Service from Front of Desk woman!!
comment: We booked Bokan as we had visited previously and thought the place had a wow factor. We had our nephew and niece visiting from Switzerland and wanted to share a special evening with them. The evening was ruined by the woman at the front desk (Julia?) who is quite frankly the rudest person we have ever had the misfortune to encounter in any restaurant. Despite having received an email confirming our booking she kept us standing in the corridor for 10 mins and kept insisting that we did not have a booking!! I even showed her the email. She was disingenuous and disinterested. In the end I asked to see her booking screen and was able to locate the booking immediately. She had no sense of how much embarrassment and upset she was causing to us all. She didn’t even apologise for her error. Atrocious level of service from her.

title: Just amazing moment...
comment: We spent a dinner at Bokan. What a really good « gastronomic » moment!  Despite the view which is amazing and so romantic, the decoration so confortable (wood, carpet, leather, slow lights....) and nice. Our culinary tasting was a very perfect moment. We choose « à la carte » dishes. Mozzarella and avocado very nice and tasty fish, scallops were so good and perfectly cooked. And even though the Paris Brest : waouuhh!  Thanks for this nice experience. I would not avoid to come back during my next trip in London for sure!

title: Great rooftop bar
comment: What a great venue with amazing views over London / Canary Wharf Ideal for a quick drink before heading out or even if you want to stay in and enjoy the views. We used the bar here a couple of times during our stay, enjoying the setting sun over London, and London by night when we returned to the hotel. The bar is very busy in the evenings and it can be hard to find a seat, but we managed to find an area outside to enjoy the last of the evening, and even enjoyed a complimentary drink from the bar. Great venue, and worth heading to for the views.

title: Friday evening dinner
comment: Fabulous views from this restaurant on the 37th floor. The food was also 1st rate, although there is a cocktail bar above you it’s still possible to have a conversation over dinner. Staff very attentive - maybe just a wee bit too much but better that than feeling adrift.

title: A Gem in Canary Wharf
comment: We arrived at 2pm for the 'Brunch' and was impressed not only with the food but also the service, the views and the chilled atmosphere. The bonus was the live Jazz band at 4pm. (which plays until 7pm) They do an offer for £49.00 which includes as much Prosecco as you can drink from 2pm till 4pm. And to be fair, the waiters do not stop pouring it! Which is nice. They also serve water and ice at the table without charge. One of our group does not drink so she was given an option to choose a Mock-tail instead. Overall the food was tastey and very satisfying. There was my pet hate of the discretionary 12.5% service charge but we didn't mind paying it because the service was very good. Definitely a place I would highly recommend and a place I would look forward to returning to.

title: Cold English Breakfast
