comment: I've stayed here 3 times on business.  Each time I have taken breakfast early (served from 06:30 during weekdays).  Each time the English breakfast items are cold, at best tepid.  I can imagine the chef starts cooking everything around 05:00 to be ready for 06:30, then places the serving dishes under an infra red light arrangement to keep it warm. Trouble is, it doesn't work!  Nothing worse than a cold clammy sausage and cold baked beans. Only thing I ate at a decent temperature was a fried egg, coz the chef cooked it while I waited! Come on Novotel, find a better solution!

title: Top view, great location!
comment: Great place! The atmosphere can take you to the sky! The staff is very friendly, they can make you drunk easily.. The view is unforgettable! Great for drinks and food also!

title: Dinner
comment: Waiting staff very friendly and helpful. Food excellent and good value, cost is in line with central London restaurants, but has the added value of great views across London. Have been for both lunch and dinner, can’t fault either, will be going again and telling my friends and work colleagues

title: Top of the world
comment: Astounding night views across the city and Thames, welcoming staff, loft-style decor. Good looking restaurant. Food is v.good value. Chef knows her stuff with excellent fusion of styles. On this occasion, starter was Scottish venison carpaccio - clever mixture of ingredients (like pomegranate and pear) truly heighten the flavours of the venison. My main was scallops and my friend had the lamb. Lamb looked and must have tasted great as the plate was clean! As with the starter, interesting mix of flavours to bring out the best in the scallops. Most notable was the black pudding accompaniment and purees. Excellent meal.  The one area they can improve is staff knowledge of the wine list. I asked if they had any SA wines and our waitress did not know and searched the menu for us. Small detail, but ability to romance the menu would have scored them Excellent.

title: Excellent food but not a clue what the waiter said
comment: This is my fourth visit here and the food keeps getting better and better. The menu has been shortened and offered exceptionally good food. There was a complimentary amuse bouche which was fantastic but had no idea what it was. We just could not understand the waiter and as each course arrived the waiter tried to explain what we were eating and we ended up having to resort to Google translate. This is becoming a bit of a London trait and such a shame for fantastic restaurants such as this.

title: Amazing Food & Service
comment: I booked this for my mothers birthday and opted for the bottomless brunch at the weekend. I could not fault the cocktails, food and definitely not the flowing prosecco. Great atmosphere and stunning views. Staff are very friendly and always on hand to help!

title: romantic dinner for two
comment: fantastic table on the 38th floor. views were incredible. menu was just right. food very good quality and presentantion superb. all the staff were helpful and polite.

title: Complete lack of service
comment: While there is no doubt Bokan is a well thought out, impressive bar & restaurant, it seems the emphasis is on the initial wow factor and stops there. The service leaves a lot to be desired. We visited on a Friday afternoon, the venue was not overly busy, maybe around 30 customers. After taking a seat, we waited for someone to take our order and kept waiting. Eventually we gave up and attempted ordering at the bar, but we were completely ignored by the staff. After returning to the table we were finally able to place an order, 40 minutes after arriving. There seemed to be one bar man with responsibility for making drinks, meaning we waited a further 20 minutes on our drinks coming. We decided to order another round, and this time we're helped by a very friendly and helpful member of staff who was happy to answer our questions regarding the drinks list. The list looks great and you are really spoiled for choice. A separate member of staff then came back to us informing that two out of the three ingredients from our Negronis were not available. Bokan is not short of staff, with around 8 staff on the floor at the time of our visit. However they were not not overly interested in serving us with a couple leant over the bar on their phones for the duration of our visit. This bar has the potential to be one of the best in the area, with fantastic views over London. But it is hugely let down by lack of service.

title: Great location, average food
comment: Bokan Situated approximately a 5 minute walk from Canary Wharf tube station, Bokan sits atop the Novotel London Canary Wharf. Bokan is spread over three floors (37th, 38th and 39th). The 37th is the formal restaurant, the 38th is the bar (serving bar food) and the 39th is a secondary bar area with an outdoor deck (see photos). The lighting throughout Bokan is very low, which on the whole works well but definitely makes reading the menu difficult!  We decided to eat in the bar area on 38 and then have a drink in the bar on 39. The service on the 38th floor was fine but not great, the service on the 39th floor was much better. The bar menu is somewhat limited with approximately 5 or 6 'main' options. I ordered the burger, which was good and which came with some fries. It's the location of Bokan that really makes this place. The views across Canary Wharf and back towards the O2 are great. The only real negative was that on the evening that I was there, 2 out of the 4 elevators weren't working, which caused a bit of a queue when I was trying to leave. Overall, not the best place to eat in Canary Wharf but it probably has some of the best views.

title: The best Drinks and FABULOUS VIEWS
comment: We visited BOKAN 39 during a girls weekend in London and the bar/drink/service was so great that we didn't feel like leaving the hotel - everything was perfect! The view as absolutely stunning! I would recommend it to everyone!

title: Stunning
comment: Everything was fab here. The views, the service, the food and drinks, the atmosphere and décor was superb. The roof top bar was the icing on the cake for a cocktail after dinner. Make sure you make a reservation as it gets busy!

title: Amazing meal
comment: Took my boyfriend here for his birthday (as we were staying in the hotel) before going to see Micky Flanagan at the O2. Mushroom risotto was to die for- best meal of my life, views were stunning and staff were lovely!

title: Incredible sunset
comment: Bokan offers sick views across London. Its set on an extremely high floor with the skyscrapers of Canary Wharf at your feet.  The interior of the place is stylish and staff are amicable.  This is a destination for absorbing the view.

title: Stunning views with average food
comment: Had booked a table last night and were seated by the window with the most amazing views. Wow. The service provided by the team was very good and very friendly. In my opinion the food was average nothing special but maybe I had high expectations due to the fabulous surroundings. They do cater for halal options but require 24 hours notice.

title: Delicious taster menu
comment: Almost worthy of a Michelin star. Delicious 7 course taster menu. Modern French food. Amazing views & good service.

title: Lovely space, expensive but good cocktails
comment: We came here for a pre-dinner drink and settled on one of their cocktails from a varied and interesting list. Both drinks were fab although they were at premium London prices. Great views but only if you book a table in advance!

title: Beautiful sunset
comment: Went to the bar for an early evening drink the views are stunning the French wine was fine! But unfortunately we had to leave the nice sofa corner and had to go upstairs because the table was reserved! Well upstairs was quite cold outside!!

title: Great food and view
comment: Worth a visit as an easier to book food with a view than the usual suspects. Modern lounge style with a bar on a split level. To be honest it’s worth a visit as a starting point for a night out. Really cool place.

title: Great food and great service
comment: We went to celebrate our anniversary and had been recommended Bokan by a few friends. And we were not disappointed! When we arrived we were taken to our table. While this was nice, we asked if we could switch to a table where both seats looked out at the view - the staff changed our table to suit our request with no hesitation.  Upon ordering our food, we asked if they could do a vegetarian tasting menu. Again, our waiter said “of course” and proceeded to explain exactly what each course would consist of, and how the could amend the fixed tasting menu to meet my needs. During the meal, we found all our servers attentive but not too in your face - the perfect level of service and we certainly didn’t feel hurried or pressured in any way. We particularly liked how a few minutes was left between each course to let us digest before the next - this gave us time to chat and take in the atmosphere. The dishes themselves were spectacular - amazing flavours and well put together. We couldn’t fault it.  We’d also like to thank our main waiter Guilloume who was the perfect blend of informative, friendly and professional - he really helped to make it a special evening for us. We will 100% visit Bokan again, and recommend to friends!

title: Disastrous experience, ruined birthday celebration
comment: We booked a table for 9 people at this venue backed by the mighty Novotel brand. I mentioned on a telephone conversation the reason for the booking (birthday celebration for my wife and other friends) and that we were bringing a cake. The person on the phone didn’t make any reference to any “policy” regarding this. On arrival we were first treated quite rudely because we were 15 min late. They lied to me in saying that they called me to see if we were coming and that because they couldn’t talk to me they cancelled my reservation. However, after a while, they “magnanimously found a table for us”. When we arrived to the table, we were told that they were going to charge us ridiculous 5GBP per person for having a cake of our own. We said that we were willing to consume on drinks much more than that ridiculous amount which would not even equate to the price of a bottle of Champagne, and we were willing to consume several of those. The staff was totally unhelpful and unwilling to compromise to avoid ruining our celebrations, even after speaking to “the manager”, who we suspect wasn’t the real manager. Because there is plenty of venues in Canary Wharf, we simply decided to leave and have our cake and plenty of drinks somewhere else.  All I can say is that a view is nothing if you have such an appealing behaviour to your customers.

title: GLORIOUS ROOFTOP BAR !!!!!
comment: Loved loved loved this rooftop bar !!!! Stayed in a hotel right opposite the Novotel so popped over to their rooftop bar. It was a Saturday and we had no trouble in getting a table outside in the sunshine. The service was quick and the views are amazing !!! Drinks prices we found quite reasonable for London. Would imagine this bar gets very busy on a Friday night when all the business people in Canary Wharf leave work places. I will definitely be returning here :)

title: Great Place
comment: This restaurant has a lot going for it. Great views, good food, amazing wine list and very pleasant service. One of the best choices in Canary Wharf for sure.

title: Cool place
comment: Situated on the 37-39 floors, this bar and restaurant offers great views and great vibes. Decor modern and cool. Food was presented very well and was very delicious. I had the chicken dish, with the fois grois. It was superb, I also had the halibut a d it was superb as well.

title: Perfect rooftop bar
comment: Came here in the summer this year, had a few drinks and took in the amazing views. It had a rustic casual look and the service was great. Great for watching the sun go down.

title: I'd leave 6 stars if I could!
comment: Wow. This place was AMAZING. We went for their Sunday Bottomless Brunch (served until 2.30pm) which was £49pp and included all you can drink Prosecco, and 3 delightful courses. I had the scallop carpaccio and my friend had the burrata. Both winners. I then had the Wagyu Burger which was insanely good. And filling! Then the tiramisu wasn't like an ordinary one (which I was thankful of) - mmmm it was TASTY.  The service was exceptional, and they even noted from my friend whilst I was in the bathroom that I was going to Dubai, and they served a little platter of shortbread and jellies with "Enjoy Dubai" on it, so cute and thoughtful. The rooftop is insane! SUCH great views. There's so much space in Bokan, split over 3 floors with the bar, restaurant, chill out area. I cannot fault it. Even the bathrooms had an insanely epic view! The barman was ace as well, really made our evening. We spent 7 hours there which FLEW by. Already recommended to everyone I have seen today, and will be doing more of that as the days go on! Thanks guys, what a great goodbye lunch and drinks. xxx

title: Good food and amazing views
comment: I have tried many bottomless brunches in London and this was one of the best. The views are spectacular with the Thames to your left and O2/Greenwich to your right. There were great choices for food and it was all very tasty. Great Prosecco and service to top it off. I'd definitely recommend a visit.

title: Great food with views to compliment
comment: Went as part of a large group for dinner. We did the tasting menu which was a journey of flavours. The service was extremely professional and they paid attention to detail. Great wine menu. Excellent overall.

title: Fantastic views, service needs improving
comment: The views are stunning and it had a nice chilled out atmosphere, with a pretty good mix of people. However the service was disappointing especially as service is added even when you get a drink from the bar. Mistakes were made and we simply ordered a bottle of wine, nothing complicated and the wine wasn't good. At a place like that even the cheaper wines should be decent.

title: Nice view - perfect sunset
comment: Very Nice bar, with good drinks and food. As a guest of Novotel, was surprised with the fancy rooftop bar and it's perfect view of London's skyline.

title: Untruthful booking policy
comment: Yes the views are amazing, yes the cocktails are good but these mean nothing if the service does not live up to the expectations. Their booking policy for the terrace appears to be simply untruthful and misleading. It's understandable that during good weather it will be busy. What is unacceptable is when you ask them to book they say that the system is blocked. Even if you say that you will call later they say that you cannot book and that you will have to walk in early. You walk in early and surprise surprise, everything is already booked for the day! So basically they will not tell you that they are fully booked and you're lured in by the hope that there will be availability. This might seem like a small detail to some but the lack of decency and honesty are definitely things that will stop me from going to this place again.

title: Average restaurant , nothing special except view
comment: Will I recommend this restaurant ,I don't think so.Food is ok, but portions are tiny ,and I mean it. Funny think is you have to book roof top bar as well if you want to use it after dinner....but booking have to be done in advance hahaha even waitress said that after diner, drink in bar is must. So Im a bit confused....

title: Stunning view, average service...
comment: Visited the rooftop bar to "escort" the sun down behind the city of london... We only tried 3 cocktails to chill, walked in with no reservation. We were seated with a bit half hearted manner but the outstanding view balanced the experience.Cocktails were nicely garnished, but tasted avarage for £13-£15 each. I would strongly recommend to check out the view and the atmosphere of the 38th floor terrace, take your photos, sip your drink and relax. Miki

title: Good Cocktails & View
comment: Very Nice view of Canary Wharf and City, good cocktails but nothing really special. Atmosphere is good, friendly waiters

title: Amazing food, stunning view, great staff, okay rooftop bar
comment: The food on the 37th floor was AMAZING! Each one of us had a starter and a main and the portions were so filling that we couldn't fit the dessert in. The best tartare I've ever had, amazing chicken with foie gras and very good wine. The views were amazing and the staff were great. It was my husband's birthday and the staff made it an amazing evening for us. After dinner we went to the rooftop bar on 39th floor. We had to wait for our drinks for a bit too long and my Banya drink was very, very bitter. Still- beautiful views, good music and overall pleasant vibe.

title: Nice view
comment: Stopped off for a few drinks while out ...wasnt staying here but wasn't a problem  It was my first visit and was surprised how nice it was ...was a Sunday night wasn't to busy ....will return

title: great meal and service
comment: Eat at this restaurant, although not on the menu, they offered to make my daughter a pizza, this was clearly hand made and a nice touch. The Steak was cooked as I had requested and tasty.

title: Spectacular view with nice food
comment: We tried their £60 testing menu.  The overall food quality was good. Out of the six courses meal, I love four out of the six dishes. Despite being rather new, you can feel the chef is trying very hard to demonstrate his creativity and the culinary technical skills. The services was also decent, and all of them were very helpful and friendly. The only complaint we had was that we were sitting around the corner, so sometimes the staff may not notice us when we needed some help.  The best of the restaurant is its unbeatable view overlooking canary wharf and the Shard. It's amazing to see the change in skyline from sunset to evening view. Even the view from restroom is amazing !  All said, I think this restaurant got a lot of potential and will be happy to make my 2nd visit soon.

title: Good food, great service and amazing view!
comment: The restaurant has a nice selection of food, about 6 choises for starters, and mains and an extensive winelist, but no need to consult the list as the sommelier will be at your service to provide you a matching wine with whathever it is your table has ordered.  I regularly visit the restaurant when I have friends visiting as the view over the city and the Thames is amazing, and the restaurant has a nice funky ambiance. Being greeted back after only visiting twice over the past 4 months shows the eye of detail of the waiters and they go out of their way to make you feel welcome.  Thank you Bokan for yet again an excellent experience and hope to see you soon!

title: Smart and stylish dining with amazing views
comment: Smart and stylish dining with amazing views, we enjoyed a superb 3 course brunch with unlimited prosecco. Relaxed atmosphere and friendly staff. We will definitely be returning!

title: Cocktails galore
comment: We came here for a drink - and WOW it was soooooo good! The views day and night are stunning, the atmosphere is cool and slick and the cocktail was yummmm. Definitely returning here!

title: Splendid views, food and service
comment: Went there tonight for a business dinner. My colleague had the crab meat, which was amazingly presented. I had the crispy hen's egg, which didn't look quite as good, but was superb. We both had the halibut, which was excellent. The service was extremely attentive, polite and knowledgeable. The one thing that I really enjoyed was the combination with both dishes of the jus and the little blobs of various sauces around the plate. A beautiful combination of tastes. We were lucky in that there was a beautiful sunset this evening, so the view from the top of the building across to the Shard and the Eye was spectacular. My tip? Ask for a table next to the window, which can only enhance the impressive view.

title: After work drinks. Great views limited wine and food selection
comment: Went for after work drinks. Huge outdoor space on the rooftop and lots of indoor space too.  Fantastic views of canary wharf , Greenwich and central london.  Lots of cocktails but limited wine and food menu ( at least where we were sitting outside). Options were olives some food on stock and chips. Also cheese at £9 per person. They could offer additional snack options.  No beers on tap which was disappointing and wine list was really limited.  Service was fine. There were 2/3 waitresses who were extremely busy. Some orders took a while and final bill took 10-15 mins of Waiting to materialize.  Will visit again but hope that the food and wine / drat beer choices are improved.

title: Good potential but need to work on service
comment: I booked a table for the 39th floor in a sunday evening. When we arrive to the 38th the hostess was not paying atention to the lifts and not even lift her head when we pass throught ( we thought that there was another one on the top floor) and the security stoped us asking if we need something, we mention the reservation and he pointed to the hostess. After confirming our reservation she took us to our table. The place have amazing views and the decor is fantastic. The cocktail menu is creative but maybe a bit to long. We ask for 2 cocktails that took around 20 minutes to arrive. for the second round we choose a glass of wine and a beer as we didn't wanted to wait such a long time but it took more than 30 minutes to arrive. Besides the wait for the drinks we ask for some food that never came, when we ask why the wait we've been told that nothing was ordered. The staff was friendly but unable to manage the floor. About the price, a bit expensive if we take in consideration the service.

title: Really friendly staff
comment: Breathtaking views, really friendly staff, excellent selection of locally brewed beers. Perfect for cocktail hour.

title: Wonderful place to stay for sure!
comment: Before booking my hotel for my trip, I took the time to read many many many reviews on hotels and especially this one. I have NO regret for booking this hotel. I would definitely stay there again and recommend it for sure. The only "negative" comment I had read about the hotel was the very slow service at the bar or the restaurant. OMG, beyond SLOW.......staff walked by me and totally ignored me and my friend. I even stood at the bar wanting a glass of wine, was standing right in front of the bartender who was YES I KNOW very busy, but he could have at least acknowledge my presence......It took for ever to get a glass of wine, and than had to ask for my check......Having said that the staff for the brunch if wonderful and if this obvious they are there to serve you and make sure your visit is as enjoyable as possible. Another comment, is that there doesn't seem to be enough tables on the 3 floors to accommodate the number of guests staying at the hotel. Also, there was NO information in the room for phone numbers such as room service, front desk, wakeup call, etc....and no visitor guide or magazine. I do have to say that these are minor issues and the hotel still deserves a 4.9 stars our of five.........

title: Great Views
comment: Went to Bokan early Saturday evening for family birthday drink the views were stunning of docklands the staff were very friendly the only fault was they tried to put us on a table outside in the rain but did move us when we complained

title: Food with a view
comment: Went here as heard great reviews after it opened and I was not disappointed. Had lunch in the restaurant and the food, service and view were second to none. It wasn't cheap, but you get what you pay for. After food we went down 1 level to the bar and had a couple of cocktails. Was going to go up one level but the top deck area was already pretty full.

title: Nice view, nice ambiance
comment: the reastaurant by itself is beautiful, very modern and trendy ! the food is amazing together with the cocktail ! Need some improvements regarding the service, specially those who welcome the guest who just exit the elevator. Very nice bar and terrace, the view is spectacular !!

title: Great drink with a superb dj music as background
comment: The location is modern and elegant with soft lights that makes everything romantic and mysterious.  Drinks are good; the price can be quite expensive but it can be worth... the location worth a lot

title: How one member of staff can ruin a night!!
comment: Went for a friends birthday, and the surroundings, ambiance, and stunning views of London seemed like the ideal scene to have some drinks and celebrate. There were only 3 of us, and the staff seem friendly, the drinks kept coming, and we was having a great time. My friend accidentally knocked a drink over, and within 2 minutes the manager came over and said that security was watching us and to calm down. (Knocking the drink over may have been coincidence). We were having a great time before this and would have easily stayed in there until closing, and spent a lot more money, but this made us want to leave straight away. The gentlemen could have come over to make sure we was good if he had a concern, or seen if we needed anything, but it felt like because security said something to him, he came over as the man, and told us to calm down. It put us off and I don't think we will be going back. There are enough rooftop bars in London, which are cheaper as well, and you won't get accused of anything either. How one person can ruin a night!!!!

title: Great view and great food
comment: I attended a private event served with a delicious buffet at the bar. Canapes were varied and very tasty. The Sauvignon Blanc wine from South Africa (Te Awa Left Field) was excellent. I will definitely come back again with friends

title: Treat people with dignity and as paying customers! Not numbers!
comment: Recently I've discovered this place and decided to bring different friends to have drinks here and spend some time together over a nice prosecco glass! This place is split on 2 floors of which both have an internal part, with just the top floor having also a roof terrace. It's at the 48th floor.  The majority of the internal design is made of wood and pastel fabric, with big cushions, chairs, and a stunning view! Literally you can see all of London!! I have the feeling of being in a winter cottage in the Alps, but with the view of being in a modern side of New York! I absolutely love it.  The restrooms are also very nice and clean, and while washing your hands you still have the opportunity of looking outside and admire the view- yes from the restroom! A Big, enormous glass will give you this! The only downside that I've found every time I visited this place and spent money from the Bar, that I'm starting to be seriously annoyed by it - is that when you sit down even before you ask for drinks, they say "you can be here just for 1 hour" even when there is no message on the table saying "reserved!".  The best part is that after one hour NO one comes to tell you "hey you need to move!". Honestly they just need to try and tell me that - they would have no idea of how I would react.  I find pretty frustrating that in a rich and expensive place like this, they could have the authority to make me move because someone else needs to sit! If the manager reads this - I have enough money to stay there for hours and hours to drink and eat and I would like to be treated with the respect I deserve as a paying customer!!  I really like this place, but the service and attitude I've received every time I visited this place, is disappointing. Please improve.  Value on the view: 10/10 Value of the service: not applicable General value: 7/10

title: Wonderful evening...
comment: 9 of us went for a celebratory evening. We started with drinks on the roof terrace, stunning views and attentive staff meant the evening started well. We all moved downstairs to our table. As there were so many of us, we sent our meal choices in advance. The waiter confirmed with us and noted who was having what. When the food came, everyone was served at the same time. The starters were magnificent, such intense and amazing flavours. When the main course came none of us were disappointed. The steak, fish and chicken dishes were cooked to perfection and accompanied with eye catching purées and foams that were packed with complimentary flavours. The wine was great, also full of flavour but not overbearing - just right! It seemed a shame to stop at the main course...the puddings and cheeses matched the quality and flavours we had already experienced and the sommelier picked us a wonderful wine to finish. Our waiter did a fantastic job and saw to all our every need. Thank you Bokan for making our celebration so enjoyable.

title: Great Views
comment: This is the place to go for drinks if you want fabulous views over London. The outside area on the top floor is just wonderful on a hot summers day. The only down side is they have stopped selling draught beer, now it's only small bottles for more or less at the same price. I won't be going back because of this, but for a one off treat I would recommend you go and have a look.

title: One has taste for fine dining
comment: 39th Floor Good Lord!!!!!!!! It was beautiful, didn't feel like the 39th floor the left was soooo smooth, the cocktails girls were at it again fine dining. Magnificent views of the skyline across london. We had a two hour slot and cocktails were flowing. Waiting staff all extremely plesant and attentive. Defo coming back with hubby. A lovely meeting place with friends before dining.

title: Sunning view - Sunday Brunch
comment: Sunning view at the top of the Novotel Canary Ward tower. Well furnish and designed dinning room. Nice and tasty plates. Definitely the place to go on Sunday brunch for any occasion. This place worth a detour. Charlotte our waitress has been very kind and professional.

title: Needs to loosen up
comment: We paid two visits to bokan on Saturday first around 7:30pm where we were directed to the bar on the top floor this was fine and the barman prepared two rounds of three drinks as my brother came to meet us before we headed out for a meal. The cocktails were good and the service was too however when we walked over to the roof terrace to take in the views where no one was sat because of the incremental weather it felt like the security had joined our party, on taking a picture on my phone of the skyline I turned and almost bumped into one of them who was so close behind me. We sat on a dry table to finish up our drinks whilst being stared at and by that time was ready to go. We went for our meal and returned around eleven. This time we were greated well and politely taken to a table on the lower level the guy was very nice and explained that if a booked table wasn't claimed in the next ten minutes we could have that as it had better views. We chose a cocktail each this time just the two of us and I went to the bar. The whole ambience of the place had changed staff felt very cold and unwelcoming and stressed. We had another round and headed up to see the now darkened skyline where we were actually followed up the stairs out onto the terrace.  To add to this upon looking at my receipts I have been overcharged on three of the four rounds and a service charge added even though I went to the bar for every drink. I am in no way a penny pincher but why have I been overcharged and what service am I paying for?  There didn't seem to be any chance of a waitered service in the bar. I stayed at the hotel and the room was excellent.

title: You need lots of patience to get a drink
comment: We went to the bar on the 38th floor to have drinks. Decor is great, and views obviously breathtaking.  However, the staff are in serious need of some training. The hostess seemed very stressed by having to deal with a few people arriving at the same time, and it showed in the service we received. Then it was 25 minutes from the time we ordered drinks for 6 people, until they finally arrived. The cocktails were ok, but nothing special - lots of ice in them! 2nd drink of a glass of Taittinger champagne was flat, so didn't finish it. All of that for prices which are astronomical. Would I go back? Maybe, but I'm not in a rush.

title: Amazing Views!
comment: Me and my partner recently visited the Bokan while staying at the Novotel (which it is attached to) and loved it! We went every evening for a drink (3 nights in a row) before going out for dinner and all I can say is that you never get bored of the amazing views! It can get busy (especially on a Friday evening) so I would ring ahead to book a table plus the drinks are a little pricey but that didn't put us off at all!

title: A Humiliating Experience
comment: Stayed at the Novotel with my family for three nights. Visited Bokan on the Friday night and it's clearly a popular venue for the beautiful people. However, on our last night I asked reception if it was ok to take my son up to the bar to see the London skyline, as it's spectacular. No problem he said. We went up to the 38th floor to be met by a young woman behind the desk who said if reception said it was fine to let a 12 year old in then it was fine. Juan behind the bar had other ideas. He said he weren't welcome and despite the place being empty, it was a condition of their licensing laws. First time I've been refused two glasses of Sprite in a hotel bar!  So, back down to the reception where the chap who said it was fine apologised profusely. Apparently if my son had been 13 rather than 12 it would have been fine. I lodged a complaint as I've never been humiliated like it by a hotel bar in my life. Another more sympathetic member staff agreed that it was outrageous.  On the Friday night I was in it there does seem to be a thread common in other reviews. Staff are unnecessarily rude and customers (including hotel guests,) are treated like we are lucky to be there.  Skyline is spectacular but if you want to be treated like a human being try AquaShard.  A horrible experience and one that really took the shine off a wonderful hotel.

title: Brunch
comment: Amazing brunch with view/ food amazing/ bottomless bubbles/ live jazz on the terrasse from 4pm I had the melon soup with goat cheese gyoza and the beef. Just incredible. Getting even better everytime I come

title: Bookings required for drinks and dinner. Excellent service, fantastic tasting menu, and those views!
comment: Visited on a Friday night with two girlfriends. Arriving early for dinner, I just assumed I'd be able to go to the bar first. On arrival it was clear that the bar equally has to be booked but fortunately they could accommodate me.  Tip: Ensure you book at the bar as well as the restaurant if you want drinks before dinner. Service during drinks was really lovely: Attentive, friendly, and prompt. Cocktails are around £13, well explained on the drinks menu, delicious and very pretty.  Dinner for us was a 6 course tasting menu (£60) with bubbles and wine on top. See photos for the excellent food. Pretty, delicious, perfect sized portions so we went away full but not over stuffed.  Watching the city go from light to dark is stunning, as you'd expect, and the bathroom with a view is a fun touch.  Will definitely go back before the summer is over to experience all over again. At 10 mins walk from Canary Wharf station, the location is convenient too, and easy for taxis to find and pick up due to hotel (Novotel) entrance.

title: Great views, slow service
comment: If you want some superb views of the city then this is the place to be! You can see Tower Bridge, the Eye, Shard etc and have a panoramic view of the centre of London.  If you are in a rush then this isn't the place to be. We waited 20 minutes for 2 coffees on a quiet Sunday night.

title: Amazing View, Drinks, Food & Service!
comment: Enticing menu of European inspired dishes, using ancient & adopted British ingredients! Top floor of the recently opened (2017) Novotel Canary Wharf Hotel. Gorgeous rooftop terrace view of the Shard, London City, London Eye etc.  Food is absolutely delicious. Everything is good (came multiple times). A true surprise is the mashed potatoes though, SUPER CREAMY and the best in the world.  There is also Jazz On The Roof with live performances on certain days!

title: Delicious brunch, amazing setting
comment: We had a superb experience here - incredible brunch. The food was mouthwatering and looked and tasted incredible, staff were also excellent. I had the tortellini, highly recommended. The dessert was a standout experience as well, wonderful chocolate tart (everything was great though). You won't be disappointed by the view!!!

title: Great food great view
comment: We all enjoyed our food - the crab salad&scallops( slightly too sweet for my taste) for starters and then he boys had steaks (very good quality meat done to perfection), lamb & sea bass for the girls- all beautifully presented. A dessert - chocolate mousse was a bit of a let down, though.  Our waitress could be slightly more attentive. We were splitting the bill four ways, but I was paying for my boyfriend and myself, but she charged my card twice for a single person, instead adding up two numbers.. a bit weird.  Much as I enjoyed the restaurant, the bar lacked the ambience and comfortable chairs. Cocktails were not that great either even though they charge as much as the Beaumont in Mayfair.

title: It was ok, but not great
comment: The views are good, but the food was just ok, not exceptional. I was there for a friend's birthday party.

title: Great view but be prepared to sweat during your meal
comment: Had dinner twice at Bokan right up on the 38th floor with a excellent view but it was extremely hot as aircon is either switch off or very weak which was not pleasant if you are in business suit. Service was slow and not great. Waiter was not friendly. Receptionist on 37th floor was not helpful and unfriendly which is strange.. Breakfast was average but at least not as hot as compare to evening time.

title: Brunch at Bökan
comment: Very nice restaurant on 38th floor of the hotel. Wonderful views across London skyline. Took brunch menu at £45 per person with unlimited prosecco during 2 hours. Food very nicely presented and full of flavour. Waiting staff all extremely plesant and attentive. Would be very happy to recommend it and would love to return if I was able to.

title: Absolutely Perfect Evening
comment: The views from each floor looking down over the Thames up to Tower Bridge and far beyond are wonderful. The tables in the restaurant are positioned well so that every guest can appreciate the vista.  The waiting service was impeccable, polite and well informed on each dish and the wines offered. However the real reason you must go to this restaurant is the food! Each dish is beautifully presented and very well composed. The combination of flavours and colours make choosing a course very difficult, every guest thought they had chosen the perfect plate. Aurelia, Head Chef, watched service with an eagle eye and it was interesting to see her so visible in the kitchen with her team. All in all a perfect meal. I highly recommend this restaurant.

title: Excellent food, staff and view!
comment: Really surprised by this restaurant! The food is amazing and the staff was perfect !  I really recommend this place.

title: lovely rootop resto
comment: on top floors of Novotel hotel in Canary Wharf, great views of city, food excellent, prices pretty reasonable

title: Lovely view
comment: Beautifull view, one of my favourite place in east London for a drink with friends. Unfortunately once again lack of service. 23 minutes for a Cocktail, never seen smile any bartender in 3 hours. And why I should pay for the service charge if I collect by myself one bottle of prosecco from the bar shell. Please make sure that you apply the service charge when you offer a service and not impose ro your customers to pay for something not delivered. And probably your staff will be more pleasant with the guest to earn more tips.  I hope next my visit will be less disappointing.

title: Tasty
comment: Grabbed a takeaway pizza as I passed. Not the cheapest takeaway but it was a a light and crispy base and flavoursome topping. An easy pleasant option

title: Amazing value for the quality!!
comment: Fabulous 360' view of London from 37 - 39th floors. Fantastic table by the window, a lazy Sunday set menu lunch with bottomless bubbly, enjoyed by all of us!

title: New Restaurant with Amazing London Skyline View
comment: The Vibes:       It is undeniable that the core reason for visiting Bokan is the sensational view. However, the trip to the dockyard location is entirely worth while as the thoughtfully rustic decoration and slick service make for a stylish dining experience.         What we Ate:        The food menu has been created by Aurelie Altemaire, the former Head Chef at L’Atelier de Joël Robuchon and the cocktails have been created by Danilo Tersigni, former GM at Mr Fogg’s.       The seared scallops with a citrus tang served on a bed of organic pearl barley warm salad, limoncello and wakame.             Premium Aberdeen Angus beef tartar served with crunchy sesame crisp and wasabi mayo for that extra kick.       The beautifully presented Whole lobster is served with green mango salad, orange & jasmine sauce.       Thoughts:       Along with the excellent views, the food in Bokan lives up to the setting. This is the perfect unique surrounding for celebrations and gathering. You can book this wonderful space for private hire to seriously impress for your summer party in Canary Wharf.

title: Quality food, Great View
comment: Wonderful view from the 37th, 38th and 39th floors of the Novotel Hotel at Canary Wharf . There is a street level entrance which gives access to an exclusive elevator that goes direct to the 37th floor . Fantastic 360 degree views of the city . Even the washrooms have views as you wash your hands . Great chef prepared meals from starters to desserts . Now this place serves quality over quantity food. On the pricey side but food definitely will excite your palette . The 37th floor is the restaurant , 38th floor are for cocktails which does not permit people below 21 yrs of age . The 39th is the rooftop bar . There are telescopes positioned around the place for free viewing of the sorroundings . Posting pictures of platings. Wonderful place , especially for special occasions. Service was good. Make reservations ahead.

title: Bokan - 38th Floor
comment: Went with a girlfriend for a "couple of drinks" to Bokan on the 38th Floor of Novotel Canary Wharf. The views from the Bar are really superb, having seen the views at 4.30pm, decided to stay all evening just to experience the night time views. We were certainly not disappointed, they are really really superb. As the bar has floor to ceiling windows, you get a spectacular view of central London. Luke who served us in the evening was also very nice and very friendly, he even made a bespoke cocktail for my friend. Jeevan who is the manager there came and checked on us often. To be fair we were there from 4.30pm - 1am, but even still it was very nice to be checked upon and so looked after by Jeevan. He also gave us a show around of the restaurant and the roof top bar. We will definitely return. The only small feedback would have is to change the olives in the bar, they really did not taste good, they were almost bitter. We had a great evening at Bokan and would definitely recommend to anyone to go there for a drink..friendly staff and amazing views guaranteed!! Just make sure you make a booking as it does get very busy!! Oh and before I forget, possibly the best bathrooms in London - even they have an amazing view!

title: Superb food, attentive service
comment: Didn't quite know what to expect when I randomly chose this place for dinner. My first impression was bit reserved, as the restaurant felt really noisy. Is adjacent to the bar, which plays music loud. Menu however looked promising; short, simple but full of interesting combinations. Service was attentive from the beginning, but there was some clumsiness as well: waiter splashed good amount of wine on the table while pouring to my glass. First they served a beautiful amuse-bouche: some kind of tomato foam with a polenta (?) chip. My main course seared Sea Bass with green olive purée, artichokes, clams and olive oil was absolutely delicious, brilliant combination of flavours, I totally fell in love with the olive purée! For dessert I chose tropical meringue with coconut, mango sorbet and candied cashew: fresh, fruity and light in the mouth, mango gave lovely kick to the meringue and coconut. Jackpot!  Overall, this place is quite pricy and routines may not be polished yet, but the high quality of food, friendly attentive staff and brilliant flavour combinations would make me return.

title: Dining with a view
comment: We had a great evening! We booked a table for pre dinner cocktails followed by a table for dinner. Both tables had an excellent view each from different sides of the building which was great.The cocktails were imaginative as was the food. We had the tasting menu so we could sample a number of things. We were both very full and sated at the end!

title: Bokan Bar - Best bar in Canary Wharf
comment: We have visited the bar on the 38th and 39th floor of the new Novotel hotel. This place has a really relaxed chilled atmosphere during the day and lively in the evening. Well designed except maybe the chairs which lack of comfort, absolutely stunning views of central London and East London. More importantly the cocktail menu is original and if you don't fancy any of it, the experienced bartenders can be creative around your taste buds. The oudoor space is fantastic spot, although you can imagine in high demand. So book a table in advance. Has become our regular since it's opening. Quite surprising to find such venue in a Novotel.

title: Absolutely Appalling!
comment: I visited Bokan on Friday night for a few drinks in your rooftop bar (39) with a few friends for one of their Birthdays. We were always going out after but really wanted to visit this place as it has of course recently opened and looked amazing.  When we arrived we were a little early so fully understandable that the table wasn’t ready but saying that, I called a good 30 mins before we was going to arrive and whoever answered the phone said the table was already ready. We stood there awkwardly in everyone’s way by the entrance for a good 10 minutes waiting for someone to simply wipe down the table and clear the glasses so we could take a seat. As we finally got taken over to the table 3 of the 5 of us take a seat and 2 of us left standing as there was only 3 chairs when the booking was for 5!  As your waiter frantically panicked looking for 2 chairs, lucky another table offered us their 2 stools as your waiter came back saying he couldn’t find any. By now you can imagine I wanted to just get up and leave due to the shambles going on around me. Couldn’t get a table with enough chairs, could just about get my table and everyone seemed a little too busy to listen to what I was saying or to help. Seemed a little under staffed to me. Finally we are at the table and 15 minutes later we get given the menu so we can order a drink. After waiting another 20 mins for her to come back and take our order, we sat there patiently and waited for our drinks. By now I wondered if they were ever going to turn up but eventually they did. I didn’t think it took that long to make a drink, we didn’t even order food! Again, must have been understaffed as it wasn’t particularly busy but all we have done so far is wait. Extremely inattentive. The drinks finally arrive! I have ordered my favourite cocktail (that isn’t even on the menu) a Pornstar Martini. At first glance is looked amazing and by now I was so thirsty I was ready to drink it in 1! I sat there and thought, this is going to be so good and make up for the experience we have had so far, but…. It was rancid. I don’t know if your bar staff have ever had a pornstar martini anywhere else but I have never had such a sour tasting, dry, small pornstar martini in my life. Even the prosecco on the side was again, extremely dry and sour to the taste. I would never order a Pornstar Martini from here ever again, even worse that one I have had from the likes of Be At One or All Bar One and this is supposed to be an amazing rooftop bar competing with the likes of Radio Rooftop and Rumpus Rooms and it was just not even comparable. Id compare it from my experience so far to my local Weather Spoons. Right, ive had enough, we are leaving, attic bar is around the corner and ive been there before and know it is a safe bet. This is me trying to salvage what dignity I have left as I have recommended this to everyone and booked it for a friends Birthday and it was just a shambles. Trying my best to keep spirits high as everyone looks like they have just had enough and want to go home. I manage to finally get hold of someone to get my bill as no one is giving eye contact so unless you chase after them, you are out of luck. I hand over this little business card that you get free at the front with a little number on it to get my card back (cant even supply the plastic tabs) and 10 minutes later get my card, and guess what? The completely wrong receipt. You literally managed to give me my card back with someone’s else’s receipt order. You can imagine how this looks, you could have given my card to the right person or if I hadn’t have checked it, I would have paid nearly a £300 bill for my 5 drink order. I flag this up immediately to get my correct receipt. With this one I ask politely to take the service charge off my receipt as I refuse to pay 12.5% for what was terrible service. Your waiter comes back with yet another receipt. This time it is our order but there appears to be an extra bottle of Rose wine on there! Again not what I ordered. Like how bloody hard isit to print a receipt out of what we ordered on our tab with our table number? Obviously very difficult. This isn’t the end though, here comes the embarrassing bit your end. When she (the original guy was obviously too embarrassed to come over) comes over to take the payment she asks ‘Why do you not want to pay the service’, I hate to say it as I am not a rude person, but I laughed in her face, I said you cant prepare a table with 5 chairs, cant put correct orders onto a receipt and im surprised I even got my bank card back. And you want me to pay you for this? She stood there stunned and said ‘the company make us ask’.  If this is true then you should be ashamed of yourselves. You charge good money for drinks alone but then expecting me to pay the extra 12.5% for the worst service I have ever received. I have received better service ordering a Bic Mac at 4am. It is up to the people paying if they want to pay service charge, hence why it is optional. To make your staff ask as to why is horrendous, everyone was looking at them and to think that is going to put me on the spot like it would most people, you are very wrong. I raised my voice and explained exactly why as your other customers listened in, in shock. I don’t know if this was just a bad experience I had or if this is just what to expect from this place. Big name, great advertising, well set up with amazing views and good money spent on the interior! But as to the service, staff and drinks, unless I see a lot of good reviews go in soon, I don’t think I will be going back or recommending this to any one I know. This just really lowered the mood and pretty much ruined our night when it was supposed to be the highlight! I hope your service will improve so no one else experiences what I did on Friday night.

title: Nice food, good views, generally good.
comment: I went here during a lunch time trip, the restaurant was generally quiet and offers good food. It's quite expensive for what it is. My general gripe was about having to order certain items separately. I think a set price lunch menu would work wonders for attracting more people from local businesses.  The food was good, I recommend the steak and the lamb cutlets. Despite it being quiet, we did have to flag the staff down a few times - you would have expected them to have seen us easily, but they sat us in the quiet end of the restaurant.

title: Sublime Panoramic Views + Good Food = Perfect London Evening
comment: The restaurant Bokan 37 is a must try in London.  Located in the Novotel Canary Wharf, this place will not disappoint you. The adornment is unique in its own style.  Being the tallest hotel in the area pays off: the restaurant offers sublime panoramic views of London’s skyline. The cuisine is remarkable; a mix of British and French, the two cultures of time altogether at one place. The food is so tasty that it can’t be expound in words. The Bokan 37 is bringing the best of the culinary industry; the Head chef is famous Aurelie Altemaire, formerly working at L'Atelier De Joël Robuchon therefore you can only expect food that lives up to a high standard.  I am definitely coming back!

title: Awful - no customer service standards and ruined my birthday totally.
comment: What an awful place. The staff were hopeless, took forever to take our order and serve us. To top it off, they actually ruined my birthday surprise that was arranged for me by my friend. They did this twice by asking him if I wanted dessert or should they bring the cake out!!! Talk about incompetence. Yet they wanted a form filling in prior to attending which was done in great detail. Clearly they don't communicate with each other. Now they are ignoring our email complaint which has been outstanding for 2 weeks. Avoid it and go elsewhere.

title: Should be great, but
comment: Great venue. Brilliant view and really well designed menu.... Then the service comes in to play.  The waitress didn't understand English. The food took ages. The bottled beers were warmish and the overal experience despite the positives above were marred by the simple fact that the service was third rate. Please tell me why restaurants don't train their staff properly? Or perhaps they are trying to do it on the cheap but with main courses nudging 30 pounds and plenty of pass through clientele they done really need to care I suppose. I can't recommend this place

title: Rooftop bar with excellent views and great service
comment: Drinks in the roof top bar. Offered amazing views of the city in all directions. Food and drinks were great and the service was exceptional (they even put up with our questions about what was contained in the food. At one point the chef came to talk to us)

title: You have no right to be this rude to paying customers!
comment: The staff are incredibly rude and make the prices up as they go along. Avoid, it's not as good as the staff think they they are.....We were there last night and the entire staff force were some of the rudest people we have ever had the misfortune to be "served" by. At the door the front of house had the snottiness attitude and was not the least bit welcoming. The bar staff had unwarranted attitude and were argumentative at every opportunity irrespective of the amount of money we were spending. They had the utter nerve to keep changing the prices of our drinks because the menus were in the "process of being updated"! Here's a tip, update the menus and THEN put them on the tables! Don't tell your staff to come up with rough numbers and then get aggressive when we state our basic consumer rights.... Unfortunately we have to return here in a few weeks for a corporate event. We'll be passing this review to our events team Monday in case there's the possibility of moving to another venue.

title: Terrible staff
comment: This place is beautiful but it's a total rip off. Firstly the lady on the door didn't want us in the bar. We turned up early as booking an area for 2 hours was £600! She said if we could find a table then we could sit at it but she didn't like the idea of 20 people and not sure why as we all have jobs and money! It took a man in our party to get a table for us and then she gave me dirty looks all night. The last straw was the prices advertised on the menu were not what we were charged. The prosecco was £10 more! Also they add 20% to your bill when you buy from the bar! Surely this is not legal! We have a company party there in 2 weeks time, I will be very rude when I go back because the staff are up themselves big time!

title: A venue with great views and appalling service
comment: The bar lounge on level 39 has really lovely panoramic views. Unfortunetly, the service is dreadful. I have never come across such rude staff anywhere in London. My colleague's birthday drinks were totally ruined. The hostess on level 38 was abrupt with no customer skills. I was made feel unwelcome. Bar staff on level 39 were even worse. On several occasions when trying to buy a drink I was totally ignored. After waiting for some time I was told I had to queue somewhere else. No further details were given or explained to me. Buying a drink each time was such a challenge. Settling payments was another issue - each time different prices were applied for the same drink. A tall waiter kept coming to our area throughout the night reminding us how we should have booked a table, despite half of the reserved ones being empty. I don't understand why would you want to turn spending clients away when the place is half empty. The overall experience was very disappointing. As an employee based in Canary Wharf, I was very excited about the opening of this venue. I thought it would be great for team outings, Friday drinks, leaving parties, etc. There is no way I'm coming backing to Bokan and will not recommend to it to anyone in Canary Wharf. When you charge premium prices for food, drinks and service, you just have to do better than my last night's experience.

title: Terrible rude service avoid
comment: Myself and my girlfriend have eaten at the restaurant a few times and also regular users of the bar and we have even booked New Year's Eve there. We decided to take two friends of ours for a drink for the first and although we didn't make a reservation we went upon arriving we was told all the tables are full which we accepted and went to have a drink at the bar whilst waiting for our drinks someone left and a table become available which we sat down to enjoy the bottle of wine and also cocktails we ordered. We was then approached by Julia who should not be working front of house and rudely said you cannot sit there even though there was no one else to take the table at the time truly disgusted with her attitude and really had put he of going to what is in theory my local bar I suggest Mondrian at London Bridge there rumpus room bar is a lot more better run with friendly staff.

title: Good food, spectacular views
comment: Nice friendly helpful people. Lady showed us the 39th floor bar area. At 7:30pm last Wednesday the area was very busy, outside there were some guys smoking. The views all around were spectacular. Went down to 37th floor for our meal. A bit away from the window but the views (sunset in particular) just great, when we left it was dark so lights had come on all around. The food was very good and well presented. Stephan, the restaurant manager, was very friendly and helpful - we had an enjoyable conversation. Our waiter was very professional and described each dish. We will return.

title: Absolutely Fantastic!
comment: I am enjoying London more and more with every visit and this time Bokan made my night truly great! It is impossible to describe that beautiful view which welcomes you when you enter the top floors! Great design, you can see that everyone's paying attention to details, decor is so interesting! Super friendly but professional staff, delicious drinks, nice music. Bokan is a perfect place for going out with friends, enjoying time with your family or having any type of meetings. Entire Hotel looks impressive and promising. This is a great new place on the map of London and definitely a MUST VISIT! I'm looking forward to stopping by again and again...  Big thanks to all bartenders, waiters and everyone who's making this place so great!

title: Excellent Lobster!
comment: Stayed at the Novotel London Canary Wharf recently and this amazing restaurant occupies one of the top floors. The food and service was superb. I cannot forget how tender my lobster was. It's highly recommended!

title: Amazing night time views
comment: The view here really is beautiful - especially at night. It was still sunny when we went for dinner in the evening (beware - it gets bright!) so I would probably recommend coming here when the sun has set.  Our waitress was super friendly. We also made a reservation for the terrace lounge after our dinner.  Food was pretty good. Not cheap, but for what you get and for the view, I think the pricing is reasonable. Although the menu online has the wrong pricing! A lot of the dishes went up by a few £s - would've expected prices to be accurate online! We ordered the scallops for starters, lamb and sea bass for mains with veg and chips for sides, and cheesecake for dessert. Starter was small, but delicious and both mains tasted good and were also pretty filling. Cheesecake was a bit different from your normal cheesecake - it was ok, but I wasn't a huge fan. We went up for late night drinks in the terrace lounge and the cocktails were reasonably priced. Shame it was quite windy and cold, as the views from up there are stunning.

title: Service as bad as view is amazing
comment: It is the second time we have visited the Bokan 38, and although the food is amazing, the service once again was very poor. The hostess welcoming us was quite abrupt (on 38, not ground floor), and for the duration of our lunch didn't spare a smile. Our waitress was lovely and smiling, but didn't follow through the lunch: ie after our food was brought (by other people), she reappeared when we were finished to ask if everything was ok. My husband explained that although the food was excellent, no as I had to go to the bar to ask for cutlery, salt&pepper, and sauce, that half of my club sandwich was cold, and the burgers were just warm. So she proceeded in telling us that if we wanted a dessert , that would be on the house However, we never saw the menu.  We had asked a second round of drinks to the young lady who served us the food, and not being a waitress, she went to the bar to ask someone to come to the table to take the order...it never happened! I had to go to the bar to check on the order to be told that they didn't have it, to go back to the table that someone would be there shortly.....We had the second round after finishing the food. Long...too long. However, when we asked for the bill, it comes very quickly with the card machine. What can I say, the view is breath taking and the concept is great, but most of the staff there should have a thorough reminder of what pro-activity and customer service are.

title: Expensive but fun, amazing views
comment: Worth coming here for the views. Needless to say the cocktails are great and the food was excellent. I dont normally go for burgers, but I had the burger here and really enjoyed it. It is expensive but what you really come for are the views. 38 storeys up with a great view of the London skyline - by day or night. We saw Tower bridge opening in the distance! There is loud music and lots of banker types, but we got a table both times we visited the bar (we only ate bar food here) and had a lovely evening. Definitely worth a visit.

title: Impressive service on a rooftop restaurant
comment: Our waiter Giullame made our special night even more special. His service was amazing. Compliments to the chef as our chicken with foie was excellent and the steak was cooked to perfection.  The views from the restaurant are impressive and the industrial decor amazed me.  Definitely one of the top restaurants in the city.

title: Amazing views for dinner or deinks
comment: This place is just amazing and if you go on a nice clear day, you'll be there for a treat. Make sure you book a table if you go on normal busy hours. All members of the staff were happy and friendly, the food was very good (I had seabass) and the prices not too bad.  Make sure you take your sunglasses if you go there when the sun is shining.

title: Nice views and good design
comment: It has a nice design and views. You can see the 360 views across the London skyline unlike the Shard where you only see one angle. The only thing is that there is a minimum spend (£30 p/p for the bar and £50 p/p for the restaurant) for booking a table for more than 6 people.

title: Awesome, Awesome, Awesome
comment: So, on the recommendation of a friend, and seeing the published photos this looked a great place to have dinner and also see the London skyline. It certainly didn't disappoint. Our table was booked for 7.15pm and we were promptly walked to out table. A cloudy day, and what could have dampened the view , soon changed to sun streaming through the cloud to highlight The Shaard and Millenium Wheel, sites we were able to see from our seats at the window table. Although the table had a 2 hour rebooking slot, something made clear in the booking, we were not made to feel as though we had to rush off or that someone was waiting for the table. As for the food. Well this has to be some of the best I have tasted in a while. From the 'amuse-Boucher ' to the main course of fillet steak, all tasted amazing. Will definitely be going back. Will have to just make up a special occasion to justify the visit. The icing on the proverbial cake has to be the roof terrace. The views from here, once evening had taken hold, were amazing. Being a little chilly that evening meant we couldn't spend as much time out there as we would have hoped but in the summer, provided it's not too British, this will be the only place you will want to be.

title: Great Views & Food, but expensive
comment: Had a romantic dinner here, views are great. Its a dark, modern vibe, food was fantastic. Service was friendly but a bit hectic, our waiter was lovely, however, other staff kept also coming to the table. Was a bit too much, then one of the Managers took my unfinished glass of wine away when I was not paying attention!!! I told my waiter and he was very apologetic, replaced the glass full, and when our bill arrived ALL our drinks were taken off the bill, which was a more than kind gesture. I think the feel of the staff came across like they were not sure what was going on, however I think the place had only just opened. I would return to this restaurant again.

title: Delightful Evening
comment: A last minute decision to have a meal with my daughter. The views and position of tables in the restaurant means that everyone can see the dramatic skyline towards the Shard. The waiting staff were kind, considerate, efficient, and very professional. The food was perfect, a great menu with a good selection for any palate, beautifully presented, and delicious to eat. The Chef came out to say hello and we heard her story of coming to work at Bōkan. All very interesting and made us feel very welcome. I would highly recommend this restaurant.

title: Great view. Slow service
comment: Live close by so decided to go for a few cocktails. Booked online a week ago. We arrived tonight and were seated quickly. Rooftop view of London is amazing in all directions. There were lots of security guards, some friendly, others less so. We were given a cocktail menu within 5 minutes of sitting down. No sign of waiting staff 15 minutes later so went to the bar to order. They take your card number to open a tab. Only stayed for one drink as a bit chilly and the seating wasn't great. Paid the bill not noticing that a 12.5% service charge was added. Very cheeky especially as I got my own drinks.

title: Sunset and dinner @ Bōkan
comment: Throughly enjoyed the experience @ 38 BŌKAN. BooKed table on the roof top for late afternoon cocktails, second round on the 37th floor and dinner on the 36th. Great afternoon and most delicious dinner. Top notch cuisine, friendly staff and most professional. Very impressed. Chicken with foie gras and curry Osso Bucco cooked to perfection. Can't wait to return

title: Great view- TERRIBLE SERVICE
comment: Such a shame that what could be a great venue is totally ruined by the attitude of the staff- This included adding unjustified charges and being offensively rude. One to avoid

title: Sunday afternoon chill
comment: We went to Bokan for drinks on the rooftop (39th floor) on a Sunday afternoon. It is an excellent experience to recommend for its decoration (East London style), atmosphere (amazing live music group) and service. Special thanks to Raul from the bar who nicely looked after us.

title: Amazing views / poor welcome
comment: We went there for a drink on a Saturday evening. The place got amazing views and is very nice with a large choice of drinks.  The only disappointment was the security at the door. My friend was told by the security lady that she was being done a favour being allowed in with trainers (nice trainers not gym trainers!). The people behind us had exactly the same remark. And when we got to the bar we noticed that 40% of the customers were actually wearing trainers. This was therefore not the best welcome you can expect from a place like that.

title: Fabulous food and service
comment: I went for dinner with my family yesterday evening. We are lucky enough to eat out a lot in top quality restaurants for business and pleasure and I can honestly say that this rates in my top 10 - probably even top 5 worldwide. The taste and presentation of all the dishes was absolutely top notch. Good quality produce beautifully prepared by the talented chef. Although this can be classed as "fine dining" , unlike a lot of other restaurants who claim fine dining, the atmosphere wasn't at all stuffy which is great. The Roof top terrace and the bar below have great views of the City skyline, the 02 and beyond. Live music plays on a Sunday which just adds to the atmosphere.  The service was good without being over the top, the waiting staff and sommelier are rightly proud of the restaurant and I would heartily recommend Bokan.  I will return.

title: Poor first visit
comment: I arrived at the restaurant to be told it was closed which was understandable given the 10pm time but was informed that bar snacks were still available. I asked for a drink and a club sandwich at the bar and was told to take a seat and someone would take my order. After thirty minutes a waitress noticed I'd been waiting and asked if I would like a glass of water (with a club sandwich please!!) she apologized for not noticing I was there (6 feet 1 and 16 stone) I took the glass of water and she disappeared again. Thirty five minutes without a drink or food order - unfortunate as it seemed to be a great place with a nice atmosphere.

title: Very nice roof bar
comment: Very good welcoming start from the entrance  Very good service and view  Drink price is quite reasonable but restaurant is bit pricey but worth it  They can think about to add another premium draught beer  I wonder why they did not think to have view / window from lift ?

title: Lunch on the 37th floor
comment: We were curious to have lunch out at this new venue in the Novotel and thoroughly enjoyed our meal there. My husband had a light crab entrée which was attractively presented. I had the most beautifully cooked grilled fish and our son enjoyed his very satisfying lamb dish. Our artistically presented desserts completed a very enjoyable lunching experience. All beautifully served.

title: Amazing "Shard" type views
comment: So a great sky bar with panoramic views across London. This is another great addition to Londons choices of high level bars with far reaching views and a cool interior.  The usual choice of cocktails abound and the atmosphere is buzzing.

title: brilliant views
comment: we didn't eat as arrived to late but did partake in a few beverages  amazing views from both inside and out  bar was very busy great atmosphere and quite fascinating watching the cocktails and drinks being made - very much a show bar  we went outside a lot of tables were reserved with times on etc but these times had long passed so we sat and made the most of the views - plently of cosy areas and lots of blankets for the cool chil

title: Touching the Sky
comment: Spectacular location for this brand-new restaurant and bar, on top of the Novotel Tower Canary Wharf (38th & 39th floors). Either if you go there for a few drinks at the bar, or for a proper meal at the restaurant, you will not be disappointed, as the venue displays a 360 view over the financial district and central London in general (Hello Shard!). Outside space can be a bit windy sometimes, although well covered to shelter guests from the infamous London rain. Live music every day is a nice touch. Drinks are excellent, and bartenders are able to prepare also cocktails off the menu. It is advisable to reserve a table in advance, as this place is the new sensation in London at the moment, so it can be very busy, and I am sure it will soon become a staple for happy hours, mostly during the forthcoming summer season.

title: Amazing food, gorgeous views, lovely staff
comment: The food is exquisite and beautifully presented, the staff are incredibly friendly and attentive. Bearing in mind the wonderful views and high standard of dining, it's very fairly priced. Loved it!

title: Fantastic venue, views and food. Service is slow.
comment: Regardless of the slow service (30 minutes for starter to arrive having waited 10 to be asked for drinks after being seated, the overall experience was very good. The senior waiting staff offered complimentary glass of wine and dessert which made up for the service issue and it seemed they had many people arrive just before we did. The views are spectacular and I would recommend it over the restaurants at the Shard, being able to get fresh air and have live jazz on the terrace is in my mind a better experience here than what you'll get at the Shard eateries.

title: Ok food, great views but pricey and slow service
comment: We went for a friend's birthday lunch on a Bank Holiday. Very impressive views out over Canary Wharf, the interior has been well designed and the view from the men's loos is something else (we all made a point of going for a look). However we waited an hour for our starters to arrive and thought they were nice it wasn't worth an hour's wait. The chef clearly was struggling and sent an amouse bouche to keep us occupied but we had to ask for bread which should have come as standard. The mains were nice but I was certainly not going to leave feeling stuffed. Slight style over substance and for the price I would expect more of a complete plate of food. We were there not long after opening so it may have been a glitch, it was only half full so they would not have coped with a full service.

title: Amazing!
comment: I'm so lucky to have this as a local bar/restaurant and have been three times since it opened. Came for a birthday lunch on Friday and it was one of the best meals I've ever had. The seared sea bass was as beautiful to look at as it was to eat and I can say the same for the chocolate and blackcurrant mousse.  The views are just amazing and the restaurant tables arranged in such a way as to make the most of them. When you think of how much you pay to go up the Shard (which I also love by the way!), you can come up here instead and enjoy a drink or a lovely meal for a similar price. Plus you get to see the river encircle the Isle of Dogs and get views of Greenwich and the city as well as 'up close' Canary Wharf. The ambience is stylish but relaxed and doesn't feel stuffy and the staff are lovely and helpful. Love it!

title: Brilliant roof top bar
comment: this review is only based on the bar. good selections of wines and spirits. great cocktail menu and good, friendly bar staff. It's a roof top bar and amazing views of London. I will go again and next make an effort to stay there.

title: Far from perfect
comment: Been there twice, first time everything was almost perfect (but we were served by a friend), second time the only good things were the cocktails and the view. I'm sorry to say, but given that I work in this industry too, I would expect the whole staff to be much more professional and welcoming. One of the bartenders kept arguing with the waitresses (one of them even started to cry, everything in front of the guests), and he tried to apologise by offering us the second round of drinks. They aim to be one of the best bars in town, but they are still very far from this achievement. Still far from a remarkable experience.

title: First class food, great service and views are unbeatable
comment: There are 360o views of London from the top - amazing views. But the restaurant is first class. The food is delicious and beautifully presented. Service is also first class. I've also eaten in the bar and the food is different as you would expect.

title: Horrid service, lovely place
comment: Bokan is by far one of the coolest, most beautiful bars/restaurants in Canary Wharf. The drinks are great and the food (although the menu looks a bit boring) is surprisingly good. The service however is so horrid that if it weren't for the terrific views, most people would never come here again. Even when empty, it can take up to 30 min for a drink. It took us nearly 10 minutes to get a menu at dinner. With proper training of the staff, this place could be spectacular. Come if you're a slow drinker or if you have serious patience.

title: An excellent meal and great view's
comment: We had dinner at Bokan. Could not fault the meet and great. The care and knowledge from all the staff. The food appearance and taste was exceptional. The view with the well spaced tables over  London and despite its location quite well priced at £50 a head including drinks. Will definitely return.

title: Review of Boken Bar in Novotel on 38th flr
comment: Drinks with friends, bar and views are breathtaking. Unfortunately as with these establishments the staff start to get rude. Some were lovely, but some are not. As we had ordered food, the barman refused to serve my partner at the bar, absolutely disgusting, it's the customers choice if they wish to order at the table or go to the bar. They ought to not let their egos get ahead of themselves, or assume people are trying to rob them of their table service. Tips are left when they are earnt and deserved.

title: Beautiful views, decor,service and lovely food
comment: We were so lucky to be invited to a meal here. The views and change of lighting as sunset occurred was exquisite. The environment was casual yet elegant, and so very comfortable  I highly recommend eating here!

title: Fabulous
comment: I loved this restaurant. I stopped at the hotel so experienced the high quality breakfast and ate dinner here twice.  The service is outstanding and helpful.
