The views over London are glorious.  On my first visit for dinner I tried the lamb which was probably some of the best lamb I've ever tasted. The dish itself is quite rich but we ordered a side of veg which balanced it out and the veg was done well.  I also tried the fillet steak. Beautifully presented with mash and roasted onions.  There is a good wine list with plenty of wines by the glass.  My only complaint was the sharing bread seemed wasteful if you're eating alone or even for 2 people. The breakfast has high quality produce carefully selected such as beautiful fruit and free range sausages. All produce appears to be British. Excellent!

title: a little pricey but really great views and service and food!
comment: Gets v crowded after 8. Nice buzz at bar,(bar menu great, some great new wines) restaurant delicious. No complaints

title: lunch
comment: I've been in Bokan for Sunday Lunch; it was open buffet; quality reasonable even more than reasonable, relaxing atmosphere with beatiful views over east London

title: A much needed addition to the Wharf’s bar and restaurant scene
comment: A very good looking venue with excellent views, including a unique rooftop terrace. The drinks are excellent and the food is above average. Many reviews have mentioned the service, and I agree that this probably the single most important issue this new venue needs to sort out. Waiting 30 minutes for a drink is not great. However, speed of bar service aside, all the staff were friendly and professional.

title: Great service
comment: Juan, excellent service and very professional you Rock!!! whether if was a pot of tea or just a conversation you rock!!!!

title: Amazing
comment: I have booked a table for a business meeting at the bar few days ago. The first impresion was stunning, great venue, friendly staff, nice atmosphere.  After waiting for few minutes for our cocktails we addressed our selfs to reception (as we could not find any manager to talk with and of the bar staff that seemed to be extremely busy) where Gloria sorted out the situation and found us a nice table at the restaurant where we had the best food experience ever!  Great food and friendly staff, definetely we will come back.

title: Excellent service!!
comment: We went to the bar for a drink after the meal and the staff were nice and I feel really welcomed. Matthew was taking care of us and he was attentive and friendly. The service was great and we enjoyed our time at there.

title: Unexpectedly fancy for a Novotel
comment: Came here for a birthday lunch for my mum as she didn't want to travel far and she lives nearby.  If you know the area or don't, it very nice to be able to check out the amazing views of the city from all angles of the building. The food was good if a little on the pricey side but the service was excellent so acceptable. They even brought some little treats out and sang happy birthday to my mum....nice touch! I'd recommend and if not for food, the roof top open air bar area is pretty special.....the view from the toilet is amazing too

title: On Top of everything
comment: I've visit Bokan for lunch with friend. From getting out of the lift, everything was breath taking - the view, the decor and will not forgot the welcome smile. Cool and friendly staff, not just service, but great hospitality. Great drinks for no money... And then the food... wow.. Every plate was top end, design, taste...everything. Probably the best new venue around the town. Looking forward to go back, they bar terrace should be open, can spend all day there... Thank you very much to all for an amazing experience.

title: Amazing night
comment: Breathtaking views, relaxed and yet upmarket.  Wonderful ambience and , as expected, top notch service.  Lovely outdoor top floor bar, gorgeous atmosphere, chilled music and cosy throws for when it got chilly. Loved it.

title: A pearl in Canary Wharf
comment: This modern European restaurant sits on the top floor of the Novotel and offers a splendid view across the Thames. We went on a Saturday night for supper and decided to go all out with the tasting menu. Everything we ate was absolutely interesting and innovative... perfectly delicious. The service was great and the wine pairing was fantastic.

title: Outstanding
comment: Went to the rooftop bar a couple of days ago. Amazing view of London, outstanding interior, incredible service! Been served by a lovely couple - Peter and Jackie. Delicious drinks!! Highly recommending to everyone.

title: Amazing food with nice view!
comment: Amazing restaurant with a beautiful view The food was outstanding, great service.  A place to visit !! I will come back for sure!

title: Good view, poor service, ordinary food
comment: The venue is great, and worth a trip for the view alone, but do not stay to eat or even drink. It took us half an hour to be seated, with staff ignoring us, and palming us off to other disinterested staff members. We eventually ordered a bottle of prosecco, which took 45 mins to arrive and 2 trips to ask why it was taking so long. We ordered a cheese platter to start, and waited almost an hour and half for this to arrive. We were however given a plate of calamari by way of apology, but we noticed that the only reason for this, was because they had ordered it by mistake, and didn't know what to do with it. The cheese board eventually arrived and was very uninspiring - not worth £20! We decided to go and eat elsewhere as the whole experience was a bit of a joke. We noticed we weren't the only table complaining, as wrong orders were being delivered and people were waiting ages for drinks. The mandatory 12.5% service charge really topped it off

title: Great rooftop bar
comment: If you love a rooftop view and cool setting this is the place for you. Really great atmosphere and city views at night. Drinks a bit pricey but probably ok for this area. Table service good and very attentive. There is an overriding smell of incense which made me sneeze but it was worth it for the views. There's a restaurant too.

title: Overbooked, poor service and wouldn't return
comment: Got to Bokan, 38th floor as we had a drinks table reservation. Upon reaching they advised it's no problem and to follow the host, to quickly estalishing that they didn't have any tables so we were asked to wait around by a confused hostess .. Initially requesting us to sit in the most empty space with no padded seating even though we'd had a reservation. Soon after a hostess places us amongst a group of others. The service was that slow that my husband ended up going to the bar himself which again was a completely disorganised. Whilst he was getting the drinks, I was asked to move as the table I was told to sit at was also booked. At this point, I was pretty mad and my husband and I left shortly after our first drink. Wouldn't return and they really need to sort their booking system / customer service out! I'd dread to think what the restaurant would be like!!

title: Fabulous Location - Some Teething Problems
comment: A Thursday night out with friends on 38 and 39 floor bar and roof terrace.  A fantastic location for views across London. The bar service needs to be tightened up with waiting times of 10-15mins not unusual whilst I was there.  The bar layout looses much space to a coffee machine and a cocktail preparation area. There are floor walking bar staff to take orders but failed to attract attention to get any service.  Be warned that apparently even ordering, paying and collecting a drink at the bar still incurs a 10% service charge.  Despite these little areas for improvement the location and setting is worth a visit for a evening.

title: Absolutely amazing view, service and food!
comment: The view was fantastic. I could see the O2, Big Ben, the shard, the Thames, London eye, Canary Wharf... everything! I would love to go to the restaurant again to watch the sunset.  When I arrived, I was greeted like a VIP. The staff were very polite and always had a smile. The staff in the restaurant were fantastic. They had a lot of knowledge about the food and wine. I asked many questions about the menu and they confidently gave me a detailed answer.  We had the charcuterie, cheese selection, fresh warm bread, tartare, red mullet with fennel, lamb cutlets with aubergine, palette cleanser and a mango and raspberry dessert. The food was amazing! Absolutely delicious!  The wine list was fantastic. There was a nice selection and if you couldn't decide then the staff were on hand to help.  I will definitely come here again! This restaurant is a great place for a romantic occasion, night out with friends, work colleagues or family gatherings. It definitely ticks all of the boxes for me.

title: Nice place for drinks with friends.
comment: Nice view from the terrace. Spacious, we were not squizzed and it was quite calm. Prices seem to be fair. Good overall experience.

title: There is a special place in my heart for Bokan
comment: I have visited this place about 15 times now and not because I live just 2 minutes walk away, but because it's so amazing, that I fell in love with it. For the restaurant: you do need to make a reservation in advance, and if you want a window table, do mention it while booking. The menu selection is amazing, I did try almost all of it. In my opinion the best from the starters are Sea Bass Carpaccio and the Squid, for the main is definitely an Angus Steak and the best dessert you must try is a Tropical Floating Island! The service so attentive, that we were recognized from the second visit.  For the bar: they have one of the best selections of cocktails. And a very good Lithuanian mixologist, that I would highly recommend getting cocktails from (don't remember what was his name). All cocktails come with a nice unusual decorations and the prices are very pleasant as well. I would definitely recommend to try a Hendricks Tea Pot! The terrace is very cozy, has loads of cushions and blankets and you can even order cigars.  Overall, it's the best sky bar I have visited in my life and there is a special place in my heart for it. Still looking up their career page, waiting for a marketing position to come up, as I would love to show the world how beautiful this place is! I would definitely recommend it to everyone and come back many more times!

title: Drinks with a view
comment: Situated in the 38th and 39th floors of the Novotel in Canary Wharf, Bokan plays to its strengths - Superb 360' views of London. There are lots of tables and I think as word gets out about this place reservations would be advised. There is an open air part of the bar which is pretty unusual at this height! The interior is very 'industrial elegant' in style with brushed brass, washed wooden floor and hide trimmed banquettes.  Drinks were good - we had excellent G&Ts served in fishbowl style glasses.  Table service was ok, a little slow and it wasn't major busy. View from the loo (which is rapidly becoming a 'thing' in London's more elevated bars) was excellent.

title: Exceptional
comment: Upon arrival there had been a slight issue with our booking however this was quickly sorted out by Sandra, who may I add was incredible and could not do enough to ensure our night was perfect!  We arrived at around 6:30pm on a busy Friday night & were given a tour of the bar area and roof top terrace and then recommended two sublime cocktails before we were sat at our table. Service throughout was faultless & we were left to our table for the remainder of the night - the beef tartare is a must!  My thanks once again to Sandra - We'll be back :-)

title: Off the wharf
comment: The only criticism is that it is off of the wharf, but having said that it's worth the walk for the open terrace at 39 floor and the bar at 38 with 360 views go enjoy. Service a bit hit and miss!

title: Poor service, overpriced, below average food but lovely views
comment: Bokan does have a beautiful view of london and very well decorated inside. However, we attended in a large group where we were told we had to order from a set menu. What was very odd, choices were very limited and cheaper to buy off the a la carte menu. Portions were very small (agree gourmet food has smaller portions but this was smaller than dishes served at the Dorchester, Oblix etc) and whilst they were presented well, the food was below average vs. similar restaurants and somewhat bland. Service was awful, food was served cold so some dishes were sent back and drinks took forever to serve. We ended up getting up to order from the bar itself. If I go back it would only be for drinks and the view

title: Good food, excellent drinks and an exceptional view
comment: Dined here on a Saturday evening. Bokan is three floors at the top of the new Novotel. All have an exceptional view, though some of the taller towers in Canary Wharf restrict views to the North. Views to the West are essentially unobstructed. We dined on the middle level which is a bar with a restricted food menu. The lower level is the restaurant with a full menu, and the upper level is a bar with bar snacks only, though it is part open to the sky. I must say I wasn't expecting much given how good the views are, but both the drinks and the food exceeded our expectations. The cocktail list runs to two full pages, and although the drinks are themed around the Docklands' mercantile past, that doesn't impact on how they work as grown-up cocktails. The few we had were well mixed and well-balanced. The food, although simple, was well executed and flavourful. Meat was cooked as requested. Service, if I'm honest was a little intermittent, but I would put that down to how busy the place was on a Saturday night. Reservations are taken separately for each floor, and I would recommend them given how crowded it gets.

title: second chance
comment: After my last dismissal attempt to make a booking i decided to visit unannounced to this well reviewed restaurant. It has a number of good reviews but i cannot see why at all. On arrival at the Novotel reception we were greeted by 5 members of staff all carrying IPads wow you may say? they directed us to the bar, but i could not see the reason for their presence as they didn't speak to us we spoke to them, very odd. On exiting the lift to the restaurant area we were met again by a very pretty young female maitre d, thats were that ends, she was confused and couldn't understand why we were there? We left the foyer and approached the bar were by we noticed behind the bar, 2 males picking leaves for garnish, 1 female waitress drinking a glass of wine and another constantly walking around making no eye contact or serving customers, strange we thought in a bar? how do they make money you may well ask. After waiting almost 10 minutes and not being acknowledged, we left and returned to the foyer area. I approached one of the same five greeters as we entered, and informed her of the extraordinary poor service we received, she apologized turned and carried on talking to the remaining 4 staff, i would love to meet the fool who employed this bunch!!.  As an employer myself, i was horrified to witness such poor customer skills and attitude to customers needs such as food and beverage, thats sarcasm!!, its obvious its not their money at stake, whilst the restaurant has good reviews this is our second time to this cheap rate hotel, this has certainly been reflected in our 2 visits, would i venture there again, no! i live here in Canary Wharf but would not recommend this restaurant or bar. Whilst tourists may stray unwittingly in, locals beware, its not good, for those who think its good value try Roka, Carluccio's, The Parlour, Plateau or The Manhattan Grill to name just 5 for those of you wishing something big and brash try Big Easy those of you who crave a view, try Nelsons column

title: Great food in super surroundings.
comment: The food was tasty, I especially liked the cheeseboard. Service was good. Price of food was reasonable for London although the price of drinks excessive. £7.90 for a small bottle of warm lager is unacceptable anywhere.

title: Amazing!!!
comment: Please give our thanks to all Bokan team! What a great place! The best food & drink & customer service in London!!!

title: Great view but slow motion service
comment: I just had drinks, which were ok. The view is great and the venue has a modern "steam punk" vibe. The service is so slow in almost unbelievable... even when it is not crowded. Good place if you are not in a rush and you don't want to drink much.

title: Great evening
comment: Had my first experience of Bokan last week and wow what a great location for an evening out. The staff were extremely attentive in both the bar and restaurant and made the visit extra special. The menu had a great selection and offered a great non complex choice which when presented looked and tasted like a top star restaurant. It's a pity the weather wasn't a little warmer as the terrace on the 39th floor would have been ideal to hangout and hear the live music that is often on offer. I was there for a business meeting but would Highly recommend a social visit also. Thanks Bokan- keep up the good work

title: Phenomenal !
comment: Visited here as we had heard good things about Aurelie and her team. We were not disappointed! We visited for Sunday lunch on 12 March during their soft opening.  On the 37th floor of the Novotel you are greeted by friendly staff who directed us to our table with spectacular views of the city. The steak tartare was one of the best I have eaten. Beautiful dish perfectly balanced and seasoned, just the thing for an enthusiastic carnivore. My wife had a haddock ravioli with a unctuous runny egg yolk.  One of the stand out dishes we tried was a filet of roast red mullet with fennel and pissaladière. I am not a big fan of fennel but this dish has converted me. It is a really well put together dish perfectly executed.  The lamb cutlets with chimichurri and charred aubergines were great and a generous portion. The shoulder of lamb with chickpeas and chorizo was rich, savoury and very moorish.  For dessert I had a rooibos parfait with grapefruit curd and blood orange. Truly superb.  Will definitely be back!!!

title: amazing restaurant
comment: I went for dinner last week, and is a beautiful new restaurant, with incredible views, great service and amazing food. i really enjoy the food, was really tasty full of textures and wonderfully cook and presented

title: A surprisingly long lunch
comment: Visiting for the first time we entered from the main road to find a warm welcome but a slow lift. As expected there is a great view but with various levels for eating and drinking it becomes slightly disjointed as restrooms are only on one level although very clean and uncluttered. Lots of staff but seemed lacking in organisation and service was slow. Food was acceptable but average and seemed obvious you were paying more for the view. Live music in the outside bar and nice place to have drinks. Lunch for five was around £250 including drinks and service  Would not rush back.

title: Extremely disappointing. Dreadful service.
comment: Extremely disappointing. Will not be returning or recommending to others. We booked this restaurant for a special occasion, a birthday meal for my boyfriend. Initially the doorman to the hotel at the entrance tried to turn my boyfriend away despite the fact he was wearing a shirt and trousers, he was also wearing white converse and therefore 'trainers'. As we were not informed there was a dress code upon booking a table, I have suspicions this could have been because another reason such as his race and nothing to do with what he was wearing. I did look on the website post our visit under their policy section to describe the dress code as ..... 'Smart casual. No athletic sportswear and shoes, no flip flops, no beach wear. Denim is acceptable. The team reserves the right to deny entrance should a guest’s attire and overall presentation not adhere to our dress code.'  After making it up to the floor of the restaurant we were then told that as we were now 10 minutes late and therefore could no longer seat us at a table. Instead we were told we could have a seat at the bar if we wished. However, as the restaurant was not even half full this seemed unreasonable why staff flat out refused to seat us at a table for lunch. Needless to say we swiftly left and instead dined at The Big Easy, a few minutes away on the DLR.  I suggest that the policy on dress code as well as the cut off for on a booking is explicitly made clear when booking a table so others do not also waste their time. We will not be trekking halfway across London to this establishment again. Dreadful.

title: Best Canary Wharf restaurant
comment: This restaurant is amazing: great view from 37th floor, good service, nice atmosphere, and fab food! I had:  - White Asparagus salad, blood orange, mixed nuts, fresh herbs - Seared Sea Bass, green olive puree, artichokes, clams & olive oil - Vanilla and lemon cheesecake, gariguette, strawberry and basil sorbet Amazing bred also.  I'll go again for sure! Amazing chefs, great team!

title: Brunch
comment: Beyond amazing. The view is phenomenal, the staff are fantastic and the setting is absolutely divine. It is very worth visiting, go, go, go x

title: Food with a View
comment: I was really excited about coming here particularly after all the hype, the restaurant and bar did not disappoint. The food was perfect and what you would expect from a restaurant like this. The menu is not incredibly long but it does have to offer a great number of dishes, I would recommend the squid as an appetiser and the lamb or to be on the safe side: go for the rib eye steak, you cannot go wrong with it. The interior is fantastic with its large windows that provide you with a great view of London from above. I will definitely be coming back, especially for the bar, which offers a huge range of interesting non-classical cocktails. A lot of the negative reviews of Bokan focused on the service, I honestly have no complaints about the service whatsoever, everyone seemed friendly, helpful and attentive to our needs.

title: Amazing views in stylish atmosphere
comment: What amazing view! 360 degrees over London, Thames, the docklands and the Isle of dogs. Incredible!! This place is very stylish and chique, so make sure you reserve a table, to make sure your trip is worth wile. Only went for drinks but they tasted delicious, staff was attentive, went during lunch it wasn't that busy. A must go!!!

title: Bokan view....
comment: Jazzy Sunday drinks. We are local to the area and have been watching the Novatel get built. We went there on Sunday about 5pm and listened to a Jazz combo while having a bottle of wine and some nibbles. The prices of drinks and food are typical hotel prices, but given the views and music, it was well worth the cost. Best to reserve as this will become quite popular once word gets around. Staff is still learning the ropes, so a little patience is warranted. we will visit again !!!

title: Great 360 degree rooftop bar views with relaxed setting
comment: Perfect location for a drink after a busy day or during the weekend, as Bokan seems to be a local late night magnet in an area that is becoming a resiðential area as well - Not business travelers per se.  Decor, music and service is great and you can take time to enjoy and relax. All year interesting venue I would think though it was a mild evening when I went

title: Sumptuous
comment: The decor, ambiance, service and views are nothing short of superb. The dinner, whilst excellent, is what I would call 'light'. All in all, though, a fabulous place perfect for a romantic evening.

title: View
comment: We really enjoyed our bar meal of a burger - really well cooked.  Views are incredible. Roof terrace was especially good. We found the service to be very good. It's a great 'date night' restaurant, which I would recommend you try.

title: Nice venue but terrible service
comment: Have been here twice just for coffee but the level of service has been appalling both times. First outing it took ages for someone to come to our table , though the place was quite. When the coffees came they were tepid at best. Next time I tried to order 2 coffees at the bar from one of waiters but he seemed to just look at me as if it was beyond him and pointed to his colleague saying he would make then and then just walked off without telling his colleague. Then I waited and waited and nothing so I gave up. That's a just a coffee God knows what happens when you have a meal there I hate to think.....

title: Amazing views!!
comment: This place is fairly new I believe! Went here on Saturday after brunch at Roka..staff are nice but the service is very slow! We waited 40 mins for one round of drinks at one point over the course of 4 hours! Think this bar will be amazing when the weather is nice as it gives great views over London. Would definitely visit again!

title: Great evening again
comment: Took two American friends here. Restaurant table by the window, facing west. Spectacular views. Had the melon gazpacho which was amazing and very different. Chicken with foie gras was very neat and different, very good. The halibut was a little cylinder shape, was very pretty and very good. Nice helpful staff. Really most enjoyable.

title: Love the place - cannot get enough!
comment: My friend and I originally went to Bōkan 2 weeks ago to the bar on level 38. Whilst we didn't get a window seat,the view was very impressive from where we sat at the bar. The cocktails were fantastic..be patient,they are definitely made with love! The staff were really friendly that we decided to book again for dinner. On arrival Andrea and her colleagues were very welcoming ,gave us a great table. We had staters,mains and desert and loved every course. Definitely worth the money (and the view helps) To top it off,the nice waitress (unfortunately did not get her name) heard it was my birthday and went over and beyond and gave me a small cake from Paul and the team. Completely unexpected and just makes us want to come back again!! Next stop the roof top!

title: Lunch was delicious but painfully slow service
comment: The views are great, the staff are attentive (Sebastian was great), food delicious but the service is PAINFULLY slow. When dining, you should never think: "where is my food?" ... but we were, for an hour. One of our party had to leave because the main took too long. They graciously took his main off the bill, which was a nice gesture, but service (including drink service) needs to speed up for the place to be considered a destination!  Don't book if you want a quick business meeting lunch.

title: The view and Food
comment: Amazing view at sunset. Must visit for couples. Book a table next to the view. Its amazing to have dinner here. The burger was just amazing along with the wine. Must Visit if you're in London .

title: Stunning views inside and outside of the plate!
comment: Visited Bokan for a special occasion (wife's birthday) and loved it! Great interior design, probably one of the best views of London, friendly service and amazing food -refined & original, with looks matching taste. Could become a regular -if only it was closer to home! But definitely worth the trip

title: I wanted to give Bokan a better rating but.....music much too loud!
comment: Four of us visited Bokan for dinner on a Friday night. We had booked the restaurant on the 37th floor for 6pm followed by a booking in the rooftop lounge on the 39th floor at 8.30pm. We were meeting up with some friends who we hadn't seen in a while. The staff were all very friendly and helpful especially the server at our table (sorry but I didn't manage to get his name). We started with one of their shared platters which was a nice mixture of charcuterie and cheese and a lovely runny scotch egg. Steak and lamb from the Josper grill was cooked just right. The wine list was interesting and, for London, reasonably priced. The view overlooking the river and towards central London was very nice - definitely one of the highlights. Based on the service, the views and the food I would have given Bokan a 4 or maybe even a 5-star rating, but unfortunately the extremely loud music ruined the evening for us.  When we arrived there was a live singer playing in the rooftop lounge on the 39th floor - playing very loudly. Luckily we were booked in the restaurant on the 37th floor - you could still hear the singer who was on the 39th floor (two floors above us!) but the overall volume wasn't too loud to impede conversation and so we had a nice time. The singer finished soon after 8pm just as we finished our meal and we moved to the 39th floor for coffee and after-dinner drinks with a nice view over Canary Wharf. When we arrived the music was loud but not completely overbearing. But as our coffee and drinks arrived the music was turned up to a volume where conversation was impossible. We asked if it could be turned down a bit, but were told that it couldn't be. So we quickly finished our drinks, paid up and left. A disappointing and noisy end to what otherwise was a nice evening.

title: Just Awful
comment: We visited on Friday 17th March and that will probably be the last time.  We arrived happy. Full of joy. It was Friday, St Patrick's day. Spring is not far away and all was right in the world. Now the concept is great and the decor in keeping with the name and the appeal of this bar and restaurant. And as for the view - fantastic! Wonderful! Terrific! The welcome was warm and inviting and we were given a table by the window and all seemed well. How we laughed and joked and smiled.  But then it all came crashing down faster than Lehman Brothers in 2008. And it came down to the crucial element of any hospitality establishment - service and quality of the product.  And I am afraid both were as terrible as each other.  We were seated at just after 6pm. Drinks menu presented to us just over five minutes later. A bit slow but no problem as admiring the view and taking it all in. Still happy. Still smiling. Our order was taken 15 minutes later. Now that is slow. Not even in a pre cursory check after five minutes to see if we were ready. But still smiling. Great company, great view and it's a Friday - what's the rush?! So now it is around 6.20pm.  Our drinks arrived just after 7. Not so happy.  We were asked by three different people if we had ordered in that time and the original waitress came over at around 6.45 to say our drinks were on our way. That was just a lie really. If you are going to lie to me at least do it in a way that makes it believable at least. And preferably not when I am starting to dehydrate. (Yes not even a water was offered at this time - I am 38 floors up - I can't go find water for myself. I am not Bear Grylls!)  But at least we have a drink! Sound the trumpets! Now let's hope they are worth the wait.  They were not. Sigh.  As for the cocktails themselves they were below average and not worth the money. It appears the alcohol may have been mixed with a Thames Water special but who am I to say? However they may have been tainted by the terrible service we had received.  But fortunately we were compensated - by a small bowl of crisps. No offer of anything else and quite insulting really that it was deemed a bowl of crisps which cost no more then 10-15p at wholesale price was more than adequate as compensation for the 45 minute wait for two drinks. At least we wouldn't die of hunger.  Amazingly we didn't fancy losing another hour of our lives waiting for another 'just serve it up and give it to them drink' so decided to leave.  Then, as for the cherry on this proverbial soggy bottomed cake (Mary would not be happy!), we had to go to the bar ourselves to pay the bill and, as our card was behind there to open the tab, it was automatically charged without us having a view of the bill let alone the chance to dispute anything on their including the 12.5% service charge! Thank the lord for that bowl of crisps!  So in conclusion if you want to lose water weight before a bodybuilding competition come here. Otherwise you are better off in other sky bars across London. And don't give them your card!

title: amazing place with average food
comment: Service was great, view was great, the restaurant is well decorated, unfortunately we didn't have a window table even if they were empty. I would recommend the place more for drinks than the restaurant as my food was really average. I had the carpaccio and cod with vegetables.

title: Classy cocktails with a view
comment: Really nice cocktail bar. Lots of novel cocktails with a London/docklands twist. Beautiful view and very warming on a coldish spring afternoon. Get in here before all the city boys do and then it's just another bar in the wharf.

title: One of the best bars in London
comment: I visited the bar at the new Novotel with some friends and we certainly were not disappointed! Classy decor combined with breathtaking views, friendly staff and exotic cocktails made for a fabulous time. Highly recommended.

title: The place to be!
comment: I have been last Thursday to Bōkan restaurant and I can say that I was amazed!! First of all, you received a warm welcome on the 38th floor from the hostesses and the manager.  Then you have this beautiful view on the 37th floor!  The starters were outstanding.  You can definitely feel the Michelin star background from the chef.  Each dish is a piece of art.  I highly recommend this place.  Thank you for this moment. I will definitely come back. It was fabulous!

title: Top top top
comment: Excellent dinner  Food very good quality better than some one of the Michelin stars in London Friendly staff professional service specially the waiters name Kinga and Guillame Bar Coktails nice and smooth create by the professionals bartenders Ben and Slavek I recommended good price for London City Thank you for the amazing dinner Soon I will be back

title: A few teething problems but huge potential for this new restaurant
comment: This place has only been open a few weeks so one would expect a few glitches. Yes the service was a bit slow and took a while to get our orders but the view more than compensated for the delays. The staff were very accommodating and knowledgeable about the food. The menu offers an eclectic mix of dishes. The starters were adequate and the choices did not particularly excite but the main course of venison pie was outstanding. The dessert was even better. The ginger pudding was full of flavour and melted in the mouth. My fellow Diner commentated that it was the best dessert they had had in 20 years. I will be back in a month to see if the issues have been ironed out and then will give a more critical review. However I can see this as becoming one of the best restaurants in Canary Wharf, if not London.

title: Mr john DC
comment: What a lovely restauarant on the top overlooking the city of London. Great friendy staff lovely food and good value . I would recommend going there just for food even if you stay elsewhere like i did .

title: Stunning new addition to the Canary Wharf skyline
comment: What a stunning new rooftop bar in Canary Wharf ! Delicious cocktails, stunning views and most of all.... impeccable service ! I only went along with a friend of mine for a few cocktails as restaurant tables were fully booked as a result of a 50% discount offer until 15/03 via squaremeal.com BUT hope to soon also sample the food ! The service of the staff was excellent. Our waiter went the extra mile. Shame I missed out on the special 50% introductory offer in the restaurant. Hopefully this review might lead into an extension to his offer for locals living in the vicinity.

title: Nice new venue to have a drink
comment: Tried the place for drinks and we booked the day before. The receptionist Sandra remembered me when I booked and gave us a very warm welcome.  The place was quite busy as it was Friday. The band was good, they were singing in the 38th floor but can be heard in 39th floor. The outside area was quite good and should be very busy when the sun is out.  The price of drinks was quite reasonable though they ran out of the house white wine early in the night. The cocktail price were reasonable. I recommend the place for drinks and will actually be back in a week.

title: Fabulous views and excellent service
comment: We had booked for the soft launch period but we were unable to reserve in the restaurant so we were offered the bar. There was a warm welcome on arrival and we were taken to a high table in the bar. I asked the person who showed us to the table if the food came from the same kitchen in the bar and the restaurant but she said it was a better menu in the restaurant, which I expected. Then she said that they had had a cancellation in the restaurant so could move us to there, which we were very happy about. Our table was right next to the window and the view was fabulous. The decor inside the restaurant and bar is very industrial, with big windows really making the best of the view. The only issue we had was the music. It was kind of annoying and it would have been nice to have something a bit more mellow to enhance the sophisticated atmosphere. We selected a very nice bottle of portuguese red and looked at the menu. Some excellent bread was brought to the table. The menu wasn't huge but we both found things we wanted to try. For starter we shared the Bokan board which had a selection of charcuterie, cheese, pate and a scotch egg. The pate lacked a bit of flavour but the scotch egg was perfectly cooked with a runny centre. For main we had the pork belly and venison pie, both were very tasty. The desserts were also very good and beautifully presented, plus good coffee to finish. The service throughout was charming, friendly and helpful. Overall we had a lovely evening. The full price of the meal would be a little high but this is definitely a place to come for a special occasion.

title: Mediocre restaurant
comment: The problems started from the moment we stepped in. I made a reservation well in advance with request for a window table. Instead of that on arrival I was told that we have table allocated at the bar !! After 10-15 minutes of pretended rush by the stuff they found a table not any near the windows.  probably worth mentioning that there were at least 3 tables available by the windows at the time we enter and left !!  We ordered drinks at the bar as we had to wait the team to sort the mistake with the reservation and we got the order wrong twice. Not to mention that one person joined minutes later and no one even bother came around to get te drink order. The restaurant food was just OK for the price you pay. However it was not explicit that all mains come without any sides and we were not promoted by the waiter to order side. It took 45 minutes for the mains to arrive and only then we realise that they don't come with sides hence we needs up eating without any.  Also it was greatly disappointing to see that they added 12.5% service charge which is not discretionary as I have noticed they claim to be in other reviews. For the service I received I would not have bothered paying any tip but they have made sure thy get what they want by the mandatory service charge.  Also they have to think about te dress code for this place if they don't want to turn it to Local Nando's - quite a few people were dressed not so appropriately for this type of establishment - to put it into perspective it is not very pleasant to see some customers with low hanging jeans and revealed bottoms . Overall it is worth no more than an overpriced observation deck. Perhaps the Hal price offer at the begging might have attracted the wrong crowd and established this venue as mediocre.

title: outstanding!
comment: Went on Saturday night for a birthday dinner. The view is amazing, though from the 38th floor this is kind of a given.  The staff were all professional, helpful and friendly and our waiter for the evening, Leon, was excellent. He Recommended the butchers plate charcuterie, and venison pie, neither of which I would generally choose, and both were exceptional!  A wide selection of wines to choose, and the night finished with a beautiful chocolate birthday cake.  We would definitely recommend Bokan and will return soon!

title: Ridiculous service charge
comment: Visited on a Saturday early evening, lovely bar & rooftop area but to be hit with a 12.5% service charge to be served by the barman at the bar is ridiculous. 330ml bottle of Aspalls for £6 + 12.5% doesn't compare with £5 pint that you can get in 2 bars nearby. Waiting staff are very friendly but charging policy needs to be looked into.

title: Will go again
comment: Disappointed not to have been given a window table when so many were available (w/o reserved signs) - perhaps they save them for hotel guests, which would be fair enough.  Service was good. Menu was pleasing, with enough appealing choices on it.  I had lamb with aubergine, my partner the cod, and a couple of sides to share. A beer each, £74 incl tip. Quite steep for just one course but food was of a reasonable enough quality.  Most people will go for the views and the bar (& terrace on a warm calm day) will be a very big draw, can see the place becoming very popular in the summer.

title: A meal with a view
comment: Fabulous food and an amazing view. The bar and restaurant occupy floors 37-39 and offer simply stunning views across all directions over London. The bar has an extensive list of cocktails and very helpful staff. Presentation is first class. The restaurant may look casual but the food is superb. We enjoyed an excellent meal suggested by Aurelie the head chef, recently at L'Atelier Robuchon- a wonderful range of flavours and textures - lentils with foie gras and duck with radish and wasabi dressing; red mullet perfectly cooked; a refreshing palate cleanser of mint and cucumber; and succulent, tender slow cooked lamb:; and finally a light creamy dessert with lime and sesame. Wonderful. Oh and the view. A great location for a night out.

title: Bokan Restaurant Novotel Canary Wharf - Exceptional!!
comment: I had the pleasure of visiting Bokan restaurant in Canary Wharf on 3rd March 2017 and I would recommend this unforgettable dining experience to everyone. The manager Jerome was outstanding, he could not have been more accommodating and truly went out of his way for us. Sandra on the welcome desk was brilliant, she greeted and welcomed us and all guests with a such warmth and charisma. We also had the pleasure of being served by Richard whose service was with a heartfelt smile and truly faultless. The food by Chef Aurelie and team was exceptional, presented beautifully and creatively.  Decor was elegant with a beautiful roof top terrace where you can enjoy a drink or two with a stunning view of London. The atmosphere second to none and I hope to visit again soon. Sincere thanks Jerome, Sandra, Richard, Chef Aurelie and team for making this such a pleasurable dining experience, I hope to visit again very soon. H x

title: Wonderful place
comment: We went with friends for a drink at the bar on the 39th floor. It was amazing.  Such a beautiful view even in the bathroom. Cocktails are very good as well and the service very nice. I really suggest Bokan for people enjoying cocktail, nice atmosphere and having a very beautiful view. I haven't tried yet the restaurant but will do soon.

title: Highly recommended!!
comment: We had dinner and drinks at Bokan and were blown away by the experience - from the staff's friendliness to the excellent food and drinks (recommend the lamb chops and charcuterie plate!). The venue itself is stunning in decor and the view makes for a truly special experience - it works well for a date night as well as a night out with colleagues. A unique evening and a welcome break from the stereotypical hotel experience, well done Novotel!

title: Wonderful staff, beautiful premises, food not worth the money
comment: Went for dinner with my husband. We live and work locally and were thrilled about this new place. Everyone from security to the waiting personnel were great, the premises and views are nothing short of fantastic, eclectic NY vibe, I loved it. We enjoyed our wine selection very much. The food though... okay it's a soft opening and will take a little time to get it right. I maybe should have said something on the night but am not in the habit of doing so. We ordered a whole lobster each and asked for separate chips as a side dish. We were told the chips would come with the meal anyway so we desisted. What we got were two very nicely cooked BUT extremely small half lobsters with the smallest portions of chips ever. Now, Rick Stein would charge the same amount for a lobster, not half of a small lobster. It was so small or else would not dare saying anything. I think the menu should say half lobster rather than whole lobster if you intend to charge £35 each. It was a soft opening so we paid half and can only think that is the reason why we got half? Amazing views would recommend it for drinks but as for food... it's okay to charge Gordon Ramsey's prices if food is on par with what is expected for that level. Last night it was below par.

title: Nice restaurant but let down by the food
comment: Overall this is a good restaurant, with very nice decor and amazing views, however it is let down by the food.  Two of us had a sharing starter with different meats and cheeses etc which was very good. We then had the venison pie and the rotisserie chicken for main courses.  Unfortunately the description of the version pie was misleading as it apparently came with winter vegetables, but these were nowhere to be seen. It's also much more of a cottage pie, than what I thought would be a nice piece of pie with a good crust. The chicken was also slightly dry and needed some kind of sauce. As sides we had chips, the smallest portion I've ever seen, salad which was fine and then cauliflower cheese "crumble". Not sure how it was a crumble and it was not nice so I would not recommend this.  We then had cocktails, with the amazing view, and these were very good. Although it's a bit cheeky that they add service to drinks for no apparent reason.  Overall a nice evening, and it is appreciated this this restaurant has only just opened, and so I'm sure it will improve. Definitely recommended for the great decor, amazing views and good cocktails, but not so much the food.

title: Top food with view
comment: New in London Incredible view, food and cocktails from michelin-star chef and award-winning barman. Staff is also super friendly. I will definitely go again

title: Great addition to the area
comment: We went to Bokan on their opening day to check the venue out and we've been back nearly everyday since!  The chef food is of great quality (ex L'Atelier Robuchon) , the service friendly and efficient. But the bar and the views are what makes us go back days after days.... the cocktails are amazing and the team on the 39th floor is one of the best you'll ever encounter.  Finally a great place in Canary Wharf

title: Teething problems
comment: Great views and drinks - but overpriced with haphazard service. Bar food took an hour to arrive... And they were understaffed. I'm sure it will improve - it's a brand new bar/restaurant so there are bound to be teething problems.

title: Soft Opening - Lessons to be learned
comment: The view from up here is what brings you here, the food is what you will go back for. And maybe the bar too! (hic!)  This visit was made during the soft opening period so we were prepared for anything to happen.  We had some issues with the meal. My starter was ice cold but the plate had been warmed up. For a pea and mint fritter, that gave the game away that they weren't freshly prepared to order. No biggie, but surprised someone would plate up something straight from the fridge and hope that the customer wouldn't notice.  We also had some issues with a member of our party who asked what she could have that was gluten and dairy free and offered alternatives or alterations, one of which arrived with dairy fairly obviously (a chocolate souffle that had a big Bokan signature chocolate (dairy) disc on it as one example). There seemed to be some disconnect with what the front of house staff were telling the kitchen crew and what was coming out.  With the other dishes, a fish dish was verging on being undercooked. A rotisserie chicken a tad dry on the breast meat section (wonderful flavour otherwise) and pork belly dishes that were well received. Despite these items, we really enjoyed the food.  We passed our comments on to staff to inform not criticise as we knew this was the soft opening but we were very keen to go and see this place. The staff were very gracious in their understanding and more than generous in removing items from the bill without us asking for this.  I imagine by the time of the official opening all these things will be ironed out and the place will be jumping. The atmosphere was great, matching the view and decor of the venue. The staff are very enthusiastic and provide a fresh venue for locals and wharfers to go to escape the other, sometimes dull, choices available on the main CW estate. Several of my group are considering hiring out part of the venue for parties, so despite the small setbacks on the night we went, we know that this place will be pretty good when it gets into full swing.  Welcome to the Wharf, Bokan!

title: Amazing view, great food
comment: Dropped in here tonight for dinner and a few drinks. Great space, friendly staff. Would definitely recommend if you are in the area.

title: Food didn't meet with expectations
comment: I have mixed feelings about the place. The set up, the location and the view from the 37th floor are all wonderful.  The drinks are good, however we didn't get the wine we originally ordered. They didn't have it in stock, we got apologiesed and we got over it. The problems were mainly with the food. Starters came quick and alright. The butternut squash soup was amazing, the beef tartar was okay.  As about mains, the burger is a burger. Nothing much to say. The chicken was however badly undercooked and quite plain.  The desserts were not even close to expectations. Yuzu tart was small and boring, barely tasted anything. The chockolate soufflé was too much, contained too many eggs and looked raw. They explained to us it was the special crunchy chocolate balls in it. It was not crunchy for sure and resembled to egg yolk badly.  The service was okay, bit more practice and it will be perfect.  I would have a better opinion if I see more effort to fix the mistakes. Sometimes it helps if you ask what you can do to make it better than simply say sorry or tell the customer they are wrong.  They contacted me days later on Facebook and offered a free drink for my next visit. I appreciate the offer, however it came late and I don't feel comfortable receiving private messages from a place I had dinner 2 weeks ago. I will not go back there, however I couldn't advice the same for anyone. Go and see, maybe it was just a bad day for me

title: Not quite the tips
comment: Bokan the restaurant is not quite at the top of Novotel Canary Wharf (or to be precise in a rather nondescript road through a closed mozzarella bar and over a canal and a short walk south of Canary Wharf). It's on the 37th floor, accessed by an impressively swift lift to the 38th floor bar and reception area, itself just below the 39th floor roof terrace. Unsurprisingly it's biggest attraction is the view it commands over vast swathes of London and from my seat northwards as far as Hertfordshire. A pity then our view was impeded by the fact we were seated at what seemed to be the only table adjacent not to a window but a metal frame. In addition to the a la carte was a lunch menu featuring two courses for £22 and three for £26. This represented quite a bargain compared with the a la carte many of whose mains (without sides) cost as much if not more than three courses on the set menu. The 50% discount on food as part of the soft launch, however, gave us an excuse to go a la carte. There is no children's menu (indeed my daughter appeared to be the only child dining) but a main of spaghetti with tomatoes and pesto was served with our staters and, as requested, without olives. It was such a substantial dish it kept her occupied beyond the finish of our mains. My wife started with burrata which was suitably creamy although the accompanying crackers were not particularly crispy. My steak tartare was beautifully served on a plate with little spots of dressing but could have had more egg yolk whisked in than I noticed. My main, a poached fillet of cod on a bed of spinach with shrimps covered in a brown foam was a sensational dish, but at £26 at full price perhaps needed to be. My wife's chunks of salmon on green beans looked a little more prosaic by comparison. A ginger pudding we shared for desert hit another high note, but the bitter stewed espressos were fairly horrible. My wife and I are admittedly fussy about coffee but never cease to be amazed by the sheer unpleasantness of espressos served in so many venues in London including those that specialise in coffee such as Caravan who really ought to know better. We enjoyed our glasses of house white until they were shown on the bill as Chablis at a fairly astonishing £9 per glass as opposed to the £5.40 for the eminently quaffable vin du maison. So all in all an accomplished meal not without the odd blip and, in common with the location of the restaurant within the hotel itself, not quite hitting the heights.

title: Service was appalling
comment: We sat in the bar area for a light business lunch, after waiting 20 minutes the waitress took our drinks order, she was clearly new and nervous, this wasn't the problem but the 30 minutes then waiting again to order food was frustrating, then 20 minutes for the food to come, I received to orders of my meat board, I had to ask the restaurant receptionist for the bread, my colleague had ordered soup of the basis that cream was not in it, due to a dairy intolerance, unfortunately this was not the case. A 25 minute wait for the coffees was the final straw, as a local business we were hoping for a fabulous restaurant nearby for lunches, not many companies allow for a 2 hour lunch break, the views are the only thing that impressed... really disappointed

title: Great Food with Amazing view
comment: Beautiful restaurant with breathtaking views of all London The food was outstanding, great service and the cocktails at the bar just perfect!  What a great place!! I will come back for sure!

title: Review of Bokan 37
comment: This a review of the restaurant, not the hotel, and it would really help if tripadvisor split the restaurant reviews from the hotel reviews. We were not staying at the hotel, but went in for dinner a few days after the hotel opened, in the 'soft launch phase'. The food is really good, all four of us were impressed. The views are spectacular, both in the restaurant and in the bars on floors 38 and 39. Service over dinner was not as polished (the wrong starter was served twice and our wine order had to be repeated as it got lost first time), but the staff were unfailingly polite. Hopefully a few more weeks to allow the staff to become familiar with the operation and everything will smooth out. We will definitely go again.

title: Wayne T
comment: Visited the bars on the 39, 38 floors and have to say I Was really impressed with the cocktails and the quality of service! Thank you Juan! My drink was amazingly well made and I very much enjoyed the presentation and added twist of edible flowers made it special.. this really impressed my date and the staff were very knowledgeable about their drinks! The views are really epic and I'd suggest that anyone visiting canary wharf should make this an addition to their plans

title: New recommended place for drinks
comment: Amazing views in canary wharf, nice drinks and friendly staff. Not expensive at all, we would be coming often :)

title: Best new rooftop restaurant in London?
comment: We had an almost perfect family lunch on a Sunday. Our table was in a corner which gave us a incredible 180 view over London. The food by Chef Aurelie was amazing, super fresh and very creative. Don't miss the "Mushrooms, Hen's Egg & Toast" and the succulent "Hereford 28 Day-Aged Ribeye Steak". The service was not only prompt and faultless but very friendly too. Last but not least the decor is stunning, nothing like I've seen before. Prices are very affordable for the level of quality. Overall would highly recommend!

title: Service a little dodgy, great food
comment: We had dinner here not long after they opened. I'm guessing staff were still being trained - we had a few problems getting what we'd asked for, but the staff were charming. The view over London is fantastic. But more importantly, the food and wine were excellent, although sometimes in VERY small portions....

title: Great Restaurant & bar with high terrace
comment: Went there for lunch on Tuesday 21st Feb, located on 3 floors starting at the 37th with a open terrace on the 39th. Great lunch menu, food was excellent and the views just fantastic.

title: "Bokan" Restaurant & Bar
comment: Excellent. stylish bar and restaurant on the top three floors of the new Novotel (opened Feb 14th 2017). Outstanding 360 degree views across the Docklands from the bar (38th floor), restaurant (39th. floor) and roof terrace (40th floor) over the river Thames to Tower Bridge, the Shard, Greenwich, the skyscrapers of the City and Canary Wharf etc.

title: Amazing
comment: Everything was just simply inspiring, great recommendation! Stunning food, incredible food and great service.

title: Excellent
comment: Spectacular views and wonderful cocktails at very reasonable prices. The staff were all very welcoming and our bartender (Juan ) was a great guy, attentive and very friendly. Thank you for a great experience.

title: What a view!
comment: I went to this restaurant which is on the three top floors of the new Novotel close to Canary Wharf. The hotel is in its 'soft opening' time. If you do not like heights do not go here. The restaurants and bars are on floors 37/38/39 and many tables are beside the windows. I went on the day when Doris was blowing the the building was rocking gently in the gale.  The service was good and the staff attentive, but not over bearing. For those who have been in a Novotel before this was very different. The decor was wood and iron work everywhere. The food was a significant step up from any Novotel I have ever been to, including those in France. I am planning another visit. I imagine that the top floor outside bar will be spectacular on a less windy day, or at night.

title: Nice décor and Roofterasse
comment: Newly opened ... must be this year's number one after work Bar in Canary Wharf. Bars are fully packed with spirits...may look a bit confusing to Amateurs . Extensive Cocktail menu and we'll presented.  Summer can come with this venue .

title: Perfection overlooking London skyline
comment: We had the chance to go up there on a very clear night and enjoyed the most amazing view in Canary Wharf.  The cocktails very delicious and very creative, we then went down to the 37th floor for dinner where a table by the window was ready for us. Stunning views.  The menu is very diverse with inspiration from both French and British cuisine.  I highly recommend the tartar as a starter, it was delicious. The mains were all well plated up, cooked and seasoned.  Service was very prompt and cheerful.  Great value for money, top notch dinner with amazing views. We will definitely be back to try out the lunch menu
